Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: The_Littlechilds
Reviews.Content: stayed here on business and found it a great base to explore central Berlin. There is an underground station just round the corner from the zoo, giving this hotel easy access to the tourist spots. The room was well presented and tidy, and showed little sign of previous use, which is a bonus. the hotel staff made me feel very at ease and were welcoming, and I was told about a great Irish bar in the Europa Centre just around the corner from the hotel. Also quiet close to the Tiergarden, which was great in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dyszki
Reviews.Content: What I liked most about this hotel was its good location.Close to subway station,walking distance from KaDeWe. Very wide selection of food served for breakfast.Nice and very helpful staff. And the presence of indoor pool . Wifi and underground parking are charged additionaly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: HarryBelgrade_Serbia
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfy staying in this hotel. Everything was as described in travellers reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: MikaelH
Reviews.Content: Nice and big hotel at an excellent location. Close to shopping and public transportation. Friendly staff. The food in the restaurant wasn't as good as the rest of the place. Nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, befuddled staff”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyjet69
Reviews.Content: This is quite a large, modern hotel. The room was one of the executive ones, wiith free wifi. At least, that was what the booking stated. However, the person at the check in couldn't work that out from what was on the screen. He was assisted by another person, who sorted it out. Check in was pretty slow - although there was no queue, it took about 8 minutes for two people. The room was comfortable with a good bed and a mini bar, and a good bathroom. Although the hotel was relatively quiet, the noise of the doors closing was quite loud, even when people were not slamming them. The lifts had pictures of food in the restaurant, and as it was already nearly 2100, we decided to have a beer then eat at the hotel. At 2120, we went to the restaurant, which had about 20 diners in it. We waited about 3 minutes for anyone to notice we were there, and then were told they were very busy. We were asked to go for a drink and we would be summonsed from the bar in about 20 minutes. We did as asked, and after 40 minutes, went back, to be given profuse apologies, and informed the restaurant was now closed. We went back to the bar and had a beer and ordered some food. My order was fine, but my colleagues was missing the chicken he'd ordered with his salad. Although this was corrected, it just added to the sense of a place in a state of minor confusion. I have rarely experienced so many mishaps in the space of about 3 hours in an hotel. Or even a hotel. I think it needs some serious management work there. There are so many good and reasonably priced hotels in Berlin. I don't think this one will be seeing us again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Ugojazz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, the rooms are comfortable and clean; it has a very good location, close to bus stop, to two underground stations and to the Zoologischer Garte, where you have the S-Bahn Station. Unfortunately in the hotel there is no free wifi, on the contrary it is quite expensive, and as long as I read on the fridge of the room, the mineral water was complimentary. But it was not so, and I had to pay for it. Fantastic breakfast, probably one of the richest I have ever seen

Reviews.Title: “Good location but unsafe. Lack of care. Management unhelpful & indifferent.”
Reviews.Author: TaheraS
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location & general reputation of this chain. Centrally located but the room though clean was cramped,dingy & needed a make over.We needed help to locate a plug point in the room & room attendant who came by promptly was polite & helpful.Complimentary internet facility on offer for the first 30 minutes in the hotel lobby was an added bonus.We stayed for a night in the last week of March. My mobile phone was kept on the coffee table by the window after I had charged the battery. I forgot to pick it up when we checked out. Called the hotel once we reached Dubai only to be told very promptly that nothing was found in our room! I also wrote several mails to the hotel address & to the Front Office with a specific request that these mails should be forwarded to the General Manager for his response. I'm still waiting! This lack of care is shocking to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location very central”
Reviews.Author: Eleanorm1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very central, shops just around the corner. Bus station and underground within walking distance. We had booked a suite and a double room and very pleased that they were beside each other. The Hotel accomodation was very good and the staff were very helpfull and polite. Breakfast was excellent with a variety of hot and cold food and plenty of it. We did not have dinner in the hotel as it appeared to be on the expensive side. As our flight was departing late in the evening there was no problem about keeping our luggage. We enjoyed our short stay in the Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hananb
Reviews.Content: now still in the hotel for my third night, very nice and clean, very good breakfast, 12.5 Euro for 24 hours of laptop in and slow internet conection is 2 much...maibe with wifi too it will be fair. lot of hotels its a part of the regular service and they dont charge for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a package with British Airways and was pleased with the location of the hotel. We arrived early and therefore the room was not ready. We checked our luggage and went off for a few hours and then returned to check in. Check in was straight forward and we went to our room. Upon entering our room we discovered it was a twin room and not the double we requested. I contacted reception and they sent up room service who just tried to push the beds together, not satisfactory. Reception then moved us, onlt to discover they had moved us to another twin room! After 3rd attempt the room did have a kingsize bed but had 2 single duvets. I contacted the manager who was very unhelpful, apparently its a German thing to have single duvets on kingsize beds, but she eventually managed to find a double duvet. The aircon in the hallways was very loud during the day. Breakfast was vast and everything was supplied that you could want, although the hot food was cold on several days. Only positive thing about this hotel is the position for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break in this very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SVDH
Reviews.Content: Great location. Just round the corner from the KaDeWe. Good long weekend rate, Excellent breakfast. Comfortable room although we got a twin and not the King Size we booked. They did oblige by pushing the beds together. One criticism. We pre-booked 2 rooms and got charged for 3. Took 2 calls to the hotel to get the overcharged amount refunded.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel well placed”
Reviews.Author: ygirsh
Reviews.Content: The crowne plaza hotel placed at Berlin city center. About 50m from a central shoping street. About 400m from city zoo. About 10 min from check point Charlee by car, etc. Breakfast is nice and rich by europian tradition. A good health center includes trademills, bikes and weight. The room itself is very comfortable and good enought to come for some rest at the afternoon and for good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - The rest was so, so.”
Reviews.Author: Andyfatowl
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in Berlin on a city break. The hotel is ideally placed for Kurfurstendamm shopping and the zoo. Otherwise most of the sights are around a kilometer+ away. That said there are some good restaurants in striking distance. Tour busses and public transport are also immediately to hand so it is OK for a base. The rooms are comfortable and what you would expect from a Crowne Plaza. The AC is old and kicks out dust which should be sorted out. The sauna is average and was populated by a local nut job when I was there. The gym relatively well equipped for a hotel gym. Staff are generally OK and helpful but If you make your pillow choice then don't expect the maid to remember it. The room will be made up with teutonic efficiency just as it was the first day, except that they don't replace the water, pillow tissue or biscuits consumed on the first day unless you ask. I have stayed in a number of Intercontinental Hotels around the world as a gold card member. Overall this is at the lower end of the experience scale.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good location - Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: ueno18
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with good location, rooms are average and you can hear the noise from the corridor. Internet in the room rather slow. During big events in Berlin, breakfast restaurant capacity is rather hectic. Better take your breakfast early. Otherwise good service, nice staff in the Lobby and the Bar. Attentive Front Office staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel in a nice neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-ss-64
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in March on a top floor in a comfortable, clean room with free internet access. Spotless bathroom. Good breakfast. Used the pool only once, due to previous comments on this site I didn´t expect much but it was warm and nice. The spa was a bit of a disappointment. The location on Nuernberger Strasse is good for shopping, KaDeWe is close by and so are many other stores and Ku´damm is just around the corner. Good restaurants can be found in the hotel and nearby. U-bahn and bus connections to other parts of the city are easy but you need to walk the first 100-200 meters or so. You can buy a Berlin Welcome Card at the reception, the card allows unlimited travel on public transport and gives discounts in various places and may be connected with a museum pass. The staff is friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a lovely part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel. We were a little worried after reading other trip advisor reports but found our experience was very different. Great breakfast. Restaurant very expensive so used local restaurants of which there are many. Hop on hop off bus stop just round the corner along with underground. Although most sites within 15 min walk from hotel. We arrived by train and weas only a 5 min taxi ride. Hotel staff efficient. Lack of smiles but service good. Free wi fi. Perhaps the rest of the Crowne Plaza's will follow suit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jane P
Reviews.Content: Hotel seems to be avrage business hotel. Locations is good, but rooms need to be refurbuished. I didn't feel cosy there. Also wi-fi was overpriced and a signal was poor. Hotel is ok if you found a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & nice bfast”
Reviews.Author: Kelly T
Reviews.Content: good location, walking distance to train station, shopping arcade, restaurant etc. the bfast is just nice and the room is clean although the design is a bit out of trend, but you don't expect much from a biz hotel right...

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: kbutler2724
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late February. My husband took part on a conference held at the hotel and I tagged along to visit the city. The hotel is clean, but the rooms are outdated and small. The location is great for the Western part of the city. I walked to the zoo and the great shopping street, Ku'Dam. But, it was about a 15 Euro taxi ride to the museums on Museum Island. One complaint is that the toiletries were not replaced as we used them and we ended our stay with a tiny sliver of soap. It also seems that the housekeeping became more cursory each day. The spa/swimming pool was pretty disappointing as well. I imagined (from the hotel's website) a larger and more luxurious spa. There is a jetted swimming pool but the water was pretty cold. There is one small sauna and on the day I visited, the naked man sitting there discouraged me from trying it. I did have a massage there one morning and the masseur was very good but the setting wasn't any nicer than your local chiropractic office.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Clean, Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: wallace404
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located and quiet. It seemed old to me, slightly over-priced and the rooms were a little small. The staff was polite but stiff. It was pretty standard by US standards and was not luxury by any means. I felt the beds were uncomfortable and although they spent a lot of effort promoting their pillows, they were ironically uncomfortable. The more I write this, the more I realize I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing exceptional...4star superior ( whatever that means )”
Reviews.Author: Presba
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel with an Air Berlin offer for a 4 night stay. All in all it was fairly cheap. The position isn't the best considering that the underground is not close, especially when it's raining and windy. You have to walk 300 meters to the bus stop to get the n°100 0 200 bus which will take you to the museum island and some evening life in Kreuzburg or Mitte. I don't think that the area is worth staying for shopping even though KAdeWe is nearby...whose soooo krass as to want to shop there??!!!??? Shopping means Italy or France even London....not Berlin. Ok, back to the Hotel...I got a 7th floor room, quiet, spacious and clean. The frigo bar is very expensive ( 3 euros for a small bottle of water..,better going to the Kaiser supermarket around the corner in Wittemburgplatz and buy your water or drinks there and put them in the fridge ). The Wi-fi is expensive and it isn't free in the lobby...a good reason for not staying here. The breakfast is buffet style with a large assortment of goodies from hot to cold dishes. The small croissants were great. I don't think I could recommend this hotel. There are same quality hotels in better positions in Berlin eg. in Kreuzburg or Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend unless the room you want is guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: NomadicPanda
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good stuff first: 1. Great Location 2. Great level of Cleanliness now the annoying part... I booked two rooms with double beds, one for me and my wife and the other for my parents. specifically requested double bed not 2 single beds, however both rooms were with single beds. The most annoying part was the lamp posts were on top of the pillow. I bumped my head on the lamp post at least 4 times. I requested the front desk to do something about the goddamn lamps, their response was that they cannot do anything about it since they were very busy (as in occupancy). The only reason why we needed a hotel was to get a good nights sleep after hectic sightseeing in Berlin and that very purpose was defeated. To make matters worse, they pushed 2 single beds together and they did not really fit well together with one bed higher than the other and in the other room there was a gap between the beds, really annoying stuff, especially considering the price... Let alone an apology, the front desk claimed it was a "standard best practice" to convert rooms when occupancy was high and beautiful view of the parking lot from the rooms :-(( Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but too many pricey extras!”
Reviews.Author: queenie_N
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely with a smooth check in and lovely clean rooms, cleaning was good and the hot water was working. The dead sea products were a lovely touch. However to use the sauna there was a ridiculous extra 15 euros to pay (literally just a sauna no steam room) and I ordered a bottle of water at 1am and was charged 11 euros. Finally the cost for wifi was too much and you would expect to not pay at a 4 star hotel. However the location was excellent with most things in walking distance and most tour buses stopped round th corner. I would recommend eating at a lovely Italian place called allegro. Overall a nice hotel but the extra charges may make up for what you save by not going to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: andyl2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Excellent location, right in the center, but at the same time not a little noisy street. Rooms excellent, clean, white coats, the staff helpful, breakfast is amazing. The hotel has a lovely swimming pool. I would recommend this hotel for both business trips and travel with friends or a couple. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: wujek_maja
Reviews.Content: Well located indeed, 20min from airport by cab. Can't say anything against service either - friendly and fast when it comes to ie. late hours of meal ordering. However, you will get a feeling that it's different era's place in look and touch, and by that I mean '90s. There is a feeling that not everything matches first impression - ie. rooms look relatively cheap for this kind of place (materials). Very close to Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best In Brand - Could Try Harder.....”
Reviews.Author: craigvassie
Reviews.Content: We're frequent visitors to wonderful Berlin; back at this particular hotel for the first time in a few years. Lovely to see the friendly concierge who's worked here for 23 years again - he's the star in an otherwise generally indifferent staff. Despite the limited refurb, the hotel is still very dated and "80's" in feel. There's new check-in desks and a refurbished lobby coffee shop. We got a 5th floor "newly refurbished executive room" that has had the shower over bath replaced and now has a walk-in shower. In reality, only the bathroom has been updated - the main part of the room hasn't been touched - not even new floorings!! The room smelt stale and musty but was fit for purpose once we'd opened the window for a while. Flash new pillow menu but it didn't feature our nasty pillows that were overstuffed with chopped up bits of foam.... Very average breakfast in Wilson's restaurant- rock hard scrambled eggs, burnt bacon, and sausages grilled on only one side and then steamed to death!! At least they now have an espresso machine!! Breakfast done on a budget. When we last stayed here what annoyed us was a corporate lack of attention to detail. That doesn't seem to have changed much - Berlin's own Basil Fawlty lookalike apparently still managing the franchise. This time round it was things like broken floor tiles in the lifts - with holes, the sloppy breakfast offering, and the filthy restaurant carpet. This hotel is the poor relation in the brand. The (truly 5*) Intercontinental is 300 yards away and at weekends often has similar rates, so shop around. Make sure you join the IHG Priority Club before booking......build points and get your freebies. Lots of new hotel openings coming up. If visiting Berlin, use the excellent Thermen Am Europa Center as a spa rather than the hotel offering. Its just across the street. For entertainment there's the Irish Bar in the basement of the Europa Center, with live music from 2130 every night except Monday. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “good location but with average services”
Reviews.Author: jianyu
Reviews.Content: My first impression on this hotel was good as The hotel is well located at the centre of Berlin (five mintues walk to Zoo, and 20 mintues from the airport by taxi). Also the receptionist was quite friendly. The breakfast was extensive with various choices, not just English breakfast. However, I was disappointed by housekeeping service as all used towels were not replaced. what they did was just to hang all used towels again even though I put them on the floor. The floor was not cleaned either. After my complaint, they replaced them. Another negative point is that they don't have facilities for children. In my opinion, it is not a hotel for a family with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidPersson
Reviews.Content: Nice 4-star hotel with a new lobby and an extensive breakfast buffe. My room was ok but a little old. Feels like the hotel has renovated the common areas but not the hotel rooms. There is a gym (relatively small) that works fine for a few work outs and a swiming pool. The hotel is nearby KaDeWe (the large retail store) and Kurfurstendam street with lots of stores. Museums and other sights are not far away but most require a taxi or public transport as Berlin is a massive city.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: colsy54
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights here and very happy .perfect for a weekend break ,just round the corner from ka de we ,the zoo and all transport connections ,rooms very good ,clean comfortable beds, nice breakfast and lounge area .hard to find a fault ,would gladly return .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel..!!”
Reviews.Author: nurse4cherry
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Berlin,my partner and I were very excited and looking forward to what lay in store! We had researched our accomodation by reading many reviews on trip advisor....and to be honest after staying in the hotel,feel some of the reviews were unfounded. Check in was unbelievably smooth and the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful.Our room was more than adequate,immaculately clean,with a beautifully comfortable....extremely large bed!!! Cosy bath robes and slippers were an added bonus.Buffet breakfast was fabulous,with so many choices and ample to keep you full until well into the afternoon.The decor throughout the hotel was very pleasing,modern and well worth the price we paid.Personally,I would recommend anyone to stay,as it is extremely close to many attractions and if I ever return to Berlin,would have no hesitation going back there again. Taxi from Tegel airport took about 10-15 minutes and cost about 20euro's with a tip.A wonderful city to visit..a wonderful hotel to stay at...and if you like traditional bars...you must go to caf'e Belmont which is situated just around the corner,turning right out of the hotel. We met some lovely people there...ask for Bob who originates from Berwick-on-Tweed......one of the lovliest men I have ever met!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: AugustaZlatkis
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel by price/offer combination, but what what we got was much better, then we had expected. I'd like to especially note very convenient location, highly qualified and friendly personnel, excellent breakfast and a very pleasant opportunity to swim before breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm in a great Capital City”
Reviews.Author: AlB56
Reviews.Content: Spent a short weekend in Berlin to bring daughter's A level studies alive... any excuse for a trip. I have visited Berlin many times but the first time I have stayed at this hotel. It is within a short walking distance of great shopping, the zoo and bus tours of Berlin. It is very well-connected by public transport to all the key sites, and is easily accessible from both airports - we used Scheonefeld airport on this occasion. We enjoyed great service from the moment we checked in and great value given location and standard of accommodation - could not fault anything. We had dinner in the lobby lounge and a great buffet breakfast to which we arrived within an hour of service closing so it was extremely busy but the full range of food was available and we were able to find a table for four without any difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Renard06
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel,great location, first class staff and good value. I am one of life's complainers and difficult to please,but we were so impressed with the Crown Plaza that I wrote to the Management to complement them on their. Please note that in all my years of travel staying in many,many hotels,this is the only one that have written to say well done!!!! You will not be be disappointed. .

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location for Berlin Sight Seeing !”
Reviews.Author: ginapeterb
Reviews.Content: I thought I would write this review quickly, the hotel very fresh in my mind, I booked 3 nights through British Airways and did a fly/hotel package, I upgraded to Free High Speed Internet/Buffet Breakfast with my room, stayed 28th/30th December, should have taken a taxi from Flughaven Tegel, but decided on the inbound journey to try public transport, on arrival at Tegel, I found it somewhat difficult to locate the bus area, it took me about 15 minutes walking up the airport concourse but eventually I found it, its E2.30 on the well documented TXL bus service goes all the way into Berlin, but its a public bus service, not a direct route airport to centrum, beware, it stops everywhere, and ends up at Hauptbahnhof, Alexanderplatz etc where it terminates. The Alexanderplatz U Bahn station is about 5 minutes walk. The Red line again stops everywhere, but takes about 15 minutes to 20 minutes to get to Wittenbergplatz, and a 10 minute walk from station entrance towards Ku"Damm, 1st right is Nurnbergerstrasse, the hotel easily recognisable as you round the corner, in my experience, a taxi is the best option if your not on a tight budget, its about 15 to 18 Euro, and definitely more comfortable. The Crowne plaza immediately puts you at ease, its spacious lobby, Nice bar to the right, and coffee/cake lounge is the place that you would want to relax, they have excellent english speaking staff, and the receptionists at check in were pleasant, friendly, accommodating, a sure sign that your business is welcomed. I decided to take the 1st evening exploring the local area, I was not disappointed, just down the road towards the U-bahn entrance at Wittenbergplatz, is the Kauf Des Westens, a tourist attraction in itself, plush designer shopping, around the streets lots of places to eat street food, Bratwursts, Currywursts, anything you want, its all there, turning right out of Nurnburgerstrasse takes you towards Kurfurstendamm, the Champs Elysee of Berlin, very tempting, and taking opposite direction down Nurnburgerstrasse and to the left, takes you past the most delightful Christmas markets, and to Zoologischergarten S Bahn station, lots of places for fast food, supermarkets, so you do not have to walk too far to get the things you want. My room was on 6th floor, spacious, clean, presentable, and comfortable, extra pillows and a choice of them, blankets, etc in the furniture drawers, room safe, iron board, iron, tea and coffee facilities, complimentary water, adequate night lighting, a well proportioned bathroom, bath, the hottest shower, i have yet encountered, thermo controlled easy to operate, bathroom toiletries, and on request, anything else you need from reception, i.e. complimentary items you might have forgot to bring. The T.V. is mainly international 24 hours news channels such as BBC World, CNN etc, Deutsche Welle, Rai Uno, the usual hotel news channels, there were other choices, pay movies etc if required. As Internet in the room was very important to me, I upgraded to have it in my room rate, although when you first log on, you have to click the 12.50 Euro option on a daily basis, here I felt the hotel has been let down by Quadriga, the system installed, its probably not the fault of the hotel or the management, but it has a tendency to speed up to a good speed, then slows down to agonisingly slow I measured it at one stage at 50 KB, and other speeds of 25MB, this stop start speed is irritating, and I suggest the facilities manager takes note of it, not a criticism, but the standard of service needs to be examined. The Breakfast/Restaraunt room is spacious and inviting, very comfortable and breakfast starts at 6am, its quiet around this time, I suggest upgrading to take breakfast in your rate, I understand its considered expensive as a separate charge to your room account, I found the choices to be pleasing, cold cuts section, salami, cheese etc, lots of different kinds of Breads, which you expect in predominantly German national cuisine, yoghurts, fruits, cereals, and english style breakfast items, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, sausage, bacon, mushrooms, and a sort of mini frikadellen, plenty of choices of fruit juices, coffee brought to your table, and cappuccino espresso, etc on a machine, all in all a high standard which is expected from Crowne Plaza hotels, good value and good service. All Berlin attractions are within a 20 minute S Bahn ride or U Bahn ride, taxis are plentiful outside, easy distance of walking to shops, Ku'Damm etc, very close, what more can you ask for...great location for visiting Berlin, High standard of customer service, the Manager and his or her staff are to be congratulated, would definitely stay here again, I enjoyed my stay. good luck. To get to the hotel via public transport from Alexanderplatz,

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is very good. It is in the center of West Berlin near the Kurfurstendumm shopping area, the zoo and the Ka-De-We shopping store.The rooms and large bed, were very comfortable with complimentary dressing gowns and clean towels every day. The mini bar was well stocked and the wines and drinks available in the bar were extremely good.The staff were very friendly and helpful. They have parking which is important in the center of Berlin. Swimming pool is free of charge, but sauna costs extra.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying stay at the Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend looked for a place near the Kadewe mall (you can't enjoy berlin without shopping), so it was perfect for us. Good service, and the room was nice, though It felt a bit outdated, with the CRT television and all..

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the shopping district and is 10 minutes (by car/bus) from the center of town. The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and spacious. The lobby was modern and it was pleasant to sit there and meet with people, or just read a book and drink a cappucino prepared in the lobby bar. One additional plus: for those travelers who eat Kosher food, the hotel provides a strictly Kosher breakfast and the hotel restaurant provides pre- packaged Kosher meals.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tretski
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It is very large, but comfortable with a modern, attractive front lobby and good sized, well decorated rooms. The front staff were very helpful and accommodating, providing recommendations and directions and even helping us to reserve tickets to see a show while we were there! The Crowne is in an excellent location, an easy cab ride from the main train station (even in rush hour!), and within walking distance of many restaurants, shopping and tourist sites (KaDeWe, the Zoo etc) as well as the subway. There is an on-site restaurant (which we did not eat at) as well as a bar and lobby lounge. All in all, a great experience. If returning to Berlin, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: globalgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as I was attending a conference there for work. When I noticed that I was staying at a Crowe Plaza hotel I immediately thought of some of my other less satisfactory stays at Holiday Inns however I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel lobby was modern and inviting and the reception staff were fantastic! Friendly but efficient. I was even more surprised when I got to my room and found complimentary sparkling water, a box of fine chocolates and to my absolute delight - a pillow menu! The room also had fluffy bathrobes and slippers. No request was too much for the staff and they were also very accommodating when I asked for directions and recommendations of things to do. There is a bar at the hotel as well as a restaurant and a lobby lounge which serves delicious cakes and light snacks. Breakfast was an extensive choice of hot and cold items including traditional German options. Delicious coffee and freshly baked breads are not to be missed! The location is also very good, close to KaDeWe department store and many Christmas markets. All in all, a surprisingly great hotel which I will definately be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: KCS
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to this hotel. It is what you would expect. Nice spacious room. The bathroom was a bit worn and a taller person may have felt claustraphoic in the shower as the ceiling was low. My main complaint is no free wi-fi. I say this every time I am in a hotel where I would expect this and hotels should wake up to this. I don't have to pay for TV so why should I pay for wi-fi? It is a basic service and given a choice between the two I would choose wi-fi The English speaking TV channels were all news channels (Sky,BBC, Bloomberg etc) - what about some other channels - eg BBC1 or a movie channel. It was soooo cold in Berlin (well colder than I expected and prepared for) that I ate down in the lobby restaurant, I had a club sandwich which was described as coming with a side salad and crisps. There was no salad so I mentioned this and I was told the salad was in the sandwich..... Hmmm think not! Won't be having that again. I am back in Berlin this week and trying a different hotel so see if that is any better

Reviews.Title: “Good location but I do not want to pay €12.50 for wifi!”
Reviews.Author: samsig
Reviews.Content: As above! Great breakfast, nice staff. Very expensive wifi. Pleasant enough hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,good location.”
Reviews.Author: alibasher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed our stay.We had a two room suite which gave us plenty of room and two bathrooms which was great!The buffet breakfast was decent enough,it was included in our room rate,don't think we would have paid 16 Euros if it hadn't been included.The wifi was 15 Euros so we just did without and used free wifi when we were out and about for checking things.Decent location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Rice_Goddess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Berlin City Center for a weekend in late October 2011. The hotel is located about 3 minutes walk from Kaufhaus des Westens (KaDeWe) Department store and 5 minutes walk from Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn Station. Nice location for the price (about EUR 115). I booked a business package room rate that includes both breakfast and internet access. Otherwise, you will have to pay them a la carte. The room looks a bit tired and needs some upgrades to match the modern decors of the lobby and entrance way. The breakfast selections were not impressive; and the waiting lines were pretty long on both Saturday and Sunday. The front desk staffs were not helpful and borderline rude. I witnessed something that simply should not have taken place at a supposedly four stars hotel. There was a non-English/ German speaker guest who needed an assistance. The front desk lady was rolling her eyes and gesturing to both me and her co-worker that the guest was mentally unstable. I did not find it funny and found her behavior to be rude and extremely unprofessional. In short, the hotel is nicely located close to the famous KaDeWe (don't forget to go to the Food Courts) and other shopping places. The service quality, however, is another story. The weekend front desk crews could use a basic sensitivity training and learn a thing or two about customer service standard for a four star hotel. Yes, that includes helping guests find the closest restaurants other than McDonald.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Clean Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PADSSydney
Reviews.Content: We were at Crown Plaza on holiday for 3 days at the end of August,. The location is excellent: close to the Ka De We and to many shops. The hotel was clean and well managed. The room needs to be refurbished. However the bed was comfortable with pillows to choose from. Breakfast and dinner were included in our package- breakfast was what you might expect in a buffet but the dinner menu in the package was rather restricted. No free WiFi and there were long waiting times to use the computers in the lobby. For us the dinner/breakfast package was a good choice and we were satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel though”
Reviews.Author: Brajo
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days in Berlin and stayed at the Crowne Plaza which was in a great location, but the hotel itself really needs to be redecorated. Rooms were not what we expected, and disappointed in the overall cleanliness. Quite obvious that the tiles are not being cleaned. There were hairs in the sink when we got there, basic toiletries provided. There were bathrobes, but the actual bath towels were more like hand towels. Would have loved a big fluffy towel when stepping out of the shower. We had a huge bed and 2 single duvets, but seemed that they just threw the covers up when they were making the bed each day, definitely not a lot of care taken. Tea/coffee facilities were on offer, but the kettle had to be moved over to the desk, where the plug was. There was a safe provided and the black out curtains were good too. The staff were very friendly. We didn't eat there, preferring to have cheaper breakfasts etc outside. Oh, and at 12.50 EUR per day for internet access, again it's cheaper to use a cafe down the street. (still can't figure this out, maybe someone can tell how a hotel can justify this price????) Last day we checked out and decided to have lunch in the hotel restaurant, Wilson's Prime Rin restaurant. There were many dishes on offer, but we chose to go with the burger (17.50 EUR for regular, and 22.50 EUR for large). Burgers came out with a generous helping of potato wedges, and salad. But when we bit into them, they were the most disgusting thing we ever ate. They were completely riddled with salt, it was as if the chef emptied a complete container in. When we pointed out the issue to the staff, they offered another meal, but at this point, we were both not in the mood. They said it was their fault, and did not accept payment for the 2 glasses of wine we had. Pity that this was the end to the trip, but kinda summed up the hotel. They need to step up to the mark, it is nowhere near the standard of Crowne Plaza hotels, I have stayed in or eaten in.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: LIMI4
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 1 minute from the K De We. Clean. Great breakfest

Reviews.Title: “friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DRDICKMAZEL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a family break and were offered a junior suite with 2 roons and 2 bathrooms. There was a choice of type of pillows. We opted for soft reather pillows. This is indicative of the level of service and care. The hotel was clean and well run. Every member of staff in all areas was helpful and friendly. They were all very patient with us. They gave advice about everything. It is difficult to make a modern international hotel feel individual, but the level of attention and care shone through to make an apparently cloned unintersting hotel into a 'home form hoem'. We hired bikes for 8 Euros per day per person. Adjusting the seats and providing baskets was all part of the service. For the kosher travaeller, the hotel provides a kosher breakfast for no extra charge and kosher facitities are nearby. The hotel is close to the KaDeWe exclusive department store. It was a good choice and we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: padamianou
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is very good. It is in the center of West Berlin near the Kurfurstendumm shopping area, the zoo and the Ka-De-We shopping store. It is about 20 minutes taxi drive from Tegel airport with a taxi cost of 15-20 euros. I find this hotel a great value for under 100 euros and it offers exactly what should one expect from a four star hotel. The room is very clean it has everything you need, confortable bed and pillows and very quiet. The restaurant is very good if you like stake and the breakfast is quite complete. There is also a nice bar if you wish to try some German beer. The negatives: You have to buy a card in order to use the computer and you have to pay in order to use the Sauna. But I have to admit that the did not charge me for either since I used them for a very short time.

Reviews.Title: “'Excellent' in terms of location. 'Poor' in terms of everything else.”
Reviews.Author: georgieva_zornitsa
Reviews.Content: I was staying with a group of other people in Crowne Plaza Hotel about two weeks ago. The location of the hotel is amazing - it is 2 minutes away from the Berlin Zoo,which is worth visiting, 5 minutes away from the great shopping center Ka De We and the underground station (Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn). The hotel itself was a disappointment to me for a few reasons. The breakfast buffet was very nice and I found everything that I would include in my breakfast. However, during our stay one of the women of our group had her purse stolen from the restaurant during breakfast. This made her stay quite unpleasant since she is not German and she had to spend two days in the embassy to retrieve a temporary document that would replace her passport. The trouble she went through did not seem to be of any interest to the staff because all they did was to say they are sorry immediately after the unfortunate event and that was it. They did not even bother to ask her if she needed anything,they just left her on her own. The rooms had everything that one would need. However, the cleaning service was of poor quality. There was a kettle provided as well as tea and coffee so I decided to have some tea one afternoon and left the used mug where I had taken it from. The next day I came back from breakfast to see that the cleaning people had not bothered to replace it. I would go to my room after a long day and find my bathrobe and the towel I had used on the chair instead of in the bathroom where they really belong. I had used the ice bucket but I left some ice in it so it had melted by the time I got up in the morning. No one even bothered to throw out the water, I don't even think that they noticed it. To be honest, if I go to Berlin again I would stay in this hotel for its convenient location ONLY. And I would be very careful not to have anything stolen from me.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Gasser1961
Reviews.Content: we were a group of 12 and this hotel entirely met all our needs. the rooms are very well equipped with everything you need albeit a bit on the small side but this wasn't a problem for us as we spent so little time in the rooms. it is near to everything - the bus stops, the sightseeing bus stops, a tube station, shopping and even only 10 minutes walk to take a boat trip. we ate in the restaurant one night and the prime rib is excellent for those that like meat, it just melts in your mouth the concierge was always very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Everything except the pool was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Swedish_thing
Reviews.Content: + great location, close to main shopping street + eveything you need in the room, boiler, minibar, tops, bathrobe, iron etc if you still missed something they could get several more things for you like tothpaste. + nice staff in the reception helped us with several things like booking nice restaurants. + I really hated the pillow but then I found the pillow meny so I changed to a much better one. - the pool was cold and no so nice.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: barakdf
Reviews.Content: great hotel 3 min from Ka De We and very close to train station , the buffet is a real great value!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel. Too bad they charge for the sauna.”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel at a great location. The gym is good and free. The swimmingpool very small, but still nice. For the tiny sauna they charge 7.50. Sad and not worth it. I was let in for free, 10 minutes before closing time, by a friendly employee. But i wouldnt have paid 7.50 for it. There seemed to be a list with VIPs that didnt have to pay. I was not on it (being Platinum didnt help). Wifi internet access however was free in my room thanks to my status. There were also chocolates and a free bottle of water in my room. Bed was very confortable - i received an upgrade and a newspaper in the morning. Also they brought me stuff to my room (toothbrush) really quickly. Good service, nice place. No club lounge available though.

Reviews.Title: “Generally fine”
Reviews.Author: Stacey M
Reviews.Content: The room is quite nice and comfortable, especially the bed, and it was clean and well-kept. The breakfast is good, with plenty of options. And the location is pretty good, close to the Ka De We shopping center. My biggest issue was the service. One evening, I needed some water and had to spend 8 EUR from the restaurant because nothing was open and there was no regular gift shop in the hotel. Ridiculous! For water. And, one morning, I asked about nearby coffee, like Caros (a local coffee shop I knew of) or Starbucks. I was told there was a Starbucks about 4 blocks away. However, when I found it, it was closed and didn't open in the morning, only the afternoon. I would expect a hotel to know this type of information, especially since one block further was a Caros, which I found on my own and which was open. Maybe I am asking too much ...? I was there for a conference and several items in the conference room also didn't work, which was inconvenient. Overall, a fine place, but the service was just not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: ahparker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a work trip a few weeks ago. It's a perfectly adequate hotel within walking distance of shopping areas and underground. The room was clean and the staff was professional.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: kaylie197
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights for business with a work colleague. The front desk told us that our room rate did not include breakfast even though I had specifically booked the reservation that included breakfast. I had to make several calls to the main reservation line and send a message through the website for the hotel to finally rectify the situation on the 2nd night. The breakfast was pretty good. The room itself was adequate; the 2 beds were twin-ish size; we did not have a particularly interesting view. The pillow menu was available. The TV was difficult to use and seemed to require a fee. The bathroom was adequate in size, although the tub was very narrow, and the shower curtain did not reach the complete length of the tub; water easily splashed out. Soap and shampoo were provided. The hotel pool is laughably small; use of the sauna requires additional fee. There was no concierge, and the front desk was not particularly friendly or helpful, although they did speak English. Good location in the city; good shopping in the area; 2 blocks away from Wittenbergplatz U-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good area for shopping & restaurants”
Reviews.Author: MacFly101
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every 6 months for 5 days on business. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, internet connection fast but very expensive. Staff are friendly and generally attentive. Room rates here are also reasonable for Berlin. Nearby (short walk through mall car park opposite hotel, base level of mall) there is a very lively Irish bar with live music most nights. Within 5 mins walking distance there is also an excellent Thai (turn right, and right again out of hotel round block) restaurant; Indian restaurant; Argentinian Steak restaurant. For shopping you are right beside the famous and impressive Ka De We Department store. Worth a visit to the food court with panoramic views of the city on the top floor. Overall, average hotel, average price in a location some distance away from tourist attractions but close to restaurants, shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Sami009
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Crowne Plazas in the past I had high expectations of this hotel however i was very dissapointed. The room was ok and clean. Wifi was charged at a ridiculously high rate - which in this day and age is unbelievable! Reception staff were rude on occasion however some were very helpful. It was a very average stay for a hotel which promises so much more!

Reviews.Title: “Headbanging”
Reviews.Author: PGGUk
Reviews.Content: Well located near underground and bus stops but not a great immediate location for bars, restaurants etc. The 100 bus is very close and passes through Tiergarten and to many of the major sites including Reichstag, Brandenburg gate, Museum INsel, TV tower ---. Way cheaper than a tour bus tho' of course you have to make up your own commentary. Very corporate hotel so although staff were pleasant can't say they were friendly. We asked for a double room but got 2 twin beds and were told there were no doubles available but they would send someone up to move the beds together. This was indeed done quickly but left the light switches behind my pillow and the lights in head banging zone. Didn't make it to the pool as we heard it was very small and were not happy that you had to pay extra for sauna etc. Nice outside breakfast terrace in addition to big restaurant space. Lots of choice for breakfast: hot and cold. Expresso from machine is way better than jug coffee brought to table. We had a deal which included internet and breakfast and the internet was good access. Good air con tho housekeeping kept increasing temperature and shutting the window so we would get back to a very warm room.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: Debannie
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you are looking mostly for value. I booked it last minute and paid only 211 Euro for two nights. THe room was adequate and everything was in good working order. The staff was friendly, but not award winning. The decor and cleanliness is not up to what I expect of a Crowne Plaza hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel beautifully located”
Reviews.Author: rgcf1954
Reviews.Content: It is located in an excelent area of Berlin, so you can find the very nice stores around (Saturn,KaDeWe.Niketown,Tommy Hilfiger,a fantastic cd store "Cover Music, etc...) and the breakfast itself and the service are impeccable. A must, if you are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable price, Minimum extras for the money”
Reviews.Author: grahamdpatterson
Reviews.Content: Great location in Central Schoneberg - Just round the corner fromKeDaWe. But make sure you have a six continent Priority Club Rewards club card to check in before 3pm - or you room might not be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Bad housekeeping service and outdated room and toilet”
Reviews.Content: Superb location. It was why I have booked the hotel. I also read reviews in The Tripadvisor, which is usually very helpful. But not this time. We had Junior Suite with two connected rooms. Rooms were quite outdated excluding LCD TV. Not the best bed I have had in four stars. But the main problem was the toilet. Typical smell of a hostel and very badly working flush in washing basin. Three times spoke to reception and with no real results. Same smell and dusty toilet. Room also smells of old tobacco smoke or something (which quite typical for outdated hotels. I was absolutely unhappy. Housekeeping quality was absolute zero.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: hore2
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in Crowne Plaza Berlin City Center in the beginning of August and we loved it. My 4-year old son stayed completely free of charge on his own bed. The hotel is centrally located, very close to the main shopping area including KaDeWe and a short walk from the underground station. Very convenient for sightseeing or eating out too. As to the hotel... It also serves delicious breakfasts and has rather efficient service. And it`s very clean. You get a nice selection of cosmetics in the bathroom and a mini bar if you like. And air-con works well. The swimming pool is small but still nice after the whole busy day. The only weak point in my view are the rooms which comparing to everything else in the hotel come a bit old; they are rather small too but I guess it`s typical in big cities. All in all, a great choice. I`m sure to stay there again next time while in Berlin! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location however room dusty and some staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Mum2005
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying here after reading reviews on Tripadvisor (we've always hit gold with hotels after reading reviews on here). However this time I was left disappointed. Check-in was speedy and friendly but aside from a great breakfast (with friendly staff) things were pretty much merely average. Our room (Junior Suite with interconnecting room for our son) was very dusty. Other issues such as the tissue box being empty in the main bedroom made me feel like our room hadn't been serviced properly for our arrival. Complimentary water (one small bottle in each room) would have been nice to have been replaced daily - as it was the housekeeping staff didn't even wash the glasses merely placed the cardboard cover back on top of a half-full glass. After a 3 night stay we looked forward to having some family fun in the pool before our flight but the pool attendant (who seemed to be training another younger person) was so unfriendly. We were playing a game of catch in the pool with our 6 year old son's swimming goggles (no-one else was in the pool) and given the goggles are plastic and light (and barely reach about a metre about the pool height) we were 'told off' by the attendant as she said they would break the pool glass lights high up the wall. She also tutted everytime we got in and out of the pool and walked to the sun lounger (as we got water on the floor). Hmmm - note to attendant people 'get wet when they swim'! Her attitude and the lack of room cleanliness really disappointed us. Such a shame as the hotel is superbly located, the breakfast is fabulous and the staff at breakfast are friendly and helpful. It would be nice to see more comments from the management of the hotel on here in response to customer's views. It would show that someone is listening and interested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! I'll recommend it to anyone who asks.”
Reviews.Author: Ofer M
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk fron the train station, close to all the restaurants + shops. Lovely rooms, excellent service, hotel restaurant hold a large veriaty of food + food is excellent. If i ever get to Berlin again i'll be sure to book the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ANev
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and I was very happy with the hotel! The hotel itself is very well maintained and the lobby and inside surrounding area is really nicely laid out and furnished extremely well. The rooms itself are very nice, thought on initial seeing them it looks like they could be stretched out a little longer because the bed is very close to the dresser with the inbuilt fridge and the tv! Apart from that the bathroom is very nice and has a really great magnifying mirror which I thought was a smashing touch and very handy for doing make up in! Do try get breakfast included in your hotel offer as it is lovely, but also not cheap if you have to fork out separately for it! Buffet was very well stocked and the staff were very helpful! The hotel is right beside the zoo, which is defo worth a visit, plus the shopping streets are very close! Plus in the Europa centre which is five mins down the road there is a great Irish pub called the Lil Irish Bar and it's a cracking place for a drink!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay for Business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: JosLelystad
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all you may expect from a member of this hotel group. Easy to find, easy and safe parking, great food, clean rooms and a helpful friendly staff. This Hotel offers all you need for a combined Business/Leisure trip. The perfect location of this hotel in the center of Berlin gives you the possibility to add a lot more to your business trip. I would recommend to stay a few days longer after your business trip and see how this hotel changes in a great holiday location

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alonbendor
Reviews.Content: a very good one. great brekfast.clean and calmness. great location in the center of berlin in the middle of the shoping district. room is nice with a/c and mini bar. even more than 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “you know what you get”
Reviews.Author: sivskatan
Reviews.Content: I always - so far - stay at the Crowne Plaza when I'm in Berlin for business (ca once a month) and it's not fantastic but still good enough for me to come back. Extremely friendly staff. Breakfast OK, but not spectacular for a four star. Good location, and lovely lovely beds. Minus for the TV-channels - too few in English.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Midor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights as part of a tour of Berlin, staff are very helpful, rooms are kept clean, breakfast is more than enough to set you up for a good day of visiting the sights. The hotel is in a very good position for shopping ,eating out and public transport,if we go back to Berlin this will be the hotel we will stay in

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice brand new lobby, remodeled rooms, excellent location !”
Reviews.Author: MaryDomRep
Reviews.Content: Just steps aways from the commercial street of Kurfürstendammand and 2 blocks from Berlin's most famous trademark department store Ka De We. Excellent choice; good rooms, good breakfast and good service !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricy and stiff service”
Reviews.Author: canadagirloo7
Reviews.Content: the Crowne Plaza is a lovely hotel but with some notable exceptions, the staff lack charm and flexibility.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: zebedee70
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to say anything bad about this hotel. Clean,modern,reasonably large rooms- the staff are helpful and efficient. Breakfast ok. I guess if you were visting for a sight-seeing break then not ideally placed.Kurfurstendamn and the Zoo handy but Brandenburg Gate and Unter Den Laden a 25 minute walk or 6Euro taxi fare away.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Reidy2011
Reviews.Content: Immaculate, stylish and modern. Friendly, knowledgeable staff who were always happy to help. Good sized rooms with everything you needed. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for short trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Oaklands_Visitor
Reviews.Content: Good Bits - Nice hot chocolate available - sauna - location for shopping - quiet at night Minor Disappointments - The pool was a bit small - Sauna was a bit expensive = 15 euros for two ,one being a child Otherwise a quite enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Near city centre at expected level”
Reviews.Author: Confmanager
Reviews.Content: Was there for a team workshop. It is at expected level of a hotel group. You will therefore not be disappointed unless you are tricky. it is not far from mall centre and shopping. nice place to move around not far from the main tour places. stayed for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: freutmich
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews on this site but moved forward with a seven night stay here. I admit I went in a little unsure of my hotel choice, but I could not have been happier! I found the staff to be incredibly friendly and helpful, my room was clean and very comfortable, and the maid service each day was quite thorough. This is also one of the rare hotels where I've actually enjoyed the burger I ordered from room service. Plus, the Wilson's restaurant in the hotel is top-notch. The location is right around the corner from an U-Bahn station and no more than a 10 minute walk from the Zoo Station, so getting anywhere in the city is a breeze. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it is what it is”
Reviews.Author: Figgysfriend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. It’s a good location for shopping and restaurants on Ku'damm, but most of the must-see places are in Mitte, which is quite a hike away, or a few stops on the U bahn. The room we were allocated was facing the main road on the second floor– which is a smokers’ floor. (There were a couple of non-smoking rooms on this floor but we were not allocated one). We had asked for a non-smoking room on our reservation and as the hotel was by no means full, it was disappointing not to have that request honoured. To be fair, the room itself did not smell of smoke but the corridor certainly did and at times quite strongly too. (Third floor is totally non-smoking.) The positives – a clean room and bathroom, good choice of pillows, nice fluffy bathrobes and fast wired internet access (cost included in deal). Free internet access (and printing) is however, available in reception. Breakfast buffet was very good. The negatives – flimsy, thin, small towels and, strangely, tumblers used on the first evening (for the complimentary bottle of water) were never replaced. They weren’t even moved until the third day and then they were merely placed back into their original position with their little paper lids on top, one of them still containing the remains of a drink. No turn down service. Parking is expensive but secure. Top tip – if you want to visit the Dome at the Reichstag and don’t fancy a tedious guided tour, – reserve a table at the rooftop restaurant online before you travel. It’s not cheap but the views are fantastic and you can wander round at your leisure. You need to reserve at least a week in advance (unless you are lucky) and take photo ID with you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Cental Position”
Reviews.Author: indefatigable
Reviews.Content: Berlin Crowne Plaza is a Crowne Plaza. That is, it is a Crowne Plaza. Clean, efficient, not too cheap, and it's a Crowne Plaza. Which is a pity, because it could perhaps be a bit more. The position is good, convenient for tourists to visit both (the old) East and West Berlin. Comfortable rooms and everything you need. But you need to pay for internet access which is so annoying, the breakfast rooms are like barns, and it just lacks soul The staff are very helpful and everything works, but I just think somebody needs to grasp that idea of "destination". So, if you can get a "deal" on a room I'd recommend it. But don't include breakfast in your price. There are lots of places for "Fruhstuck" just around the corner, and cheap too. And if you really want to push the boat out eat breakfast at Cafe Einstein on Kurfurstenstrasse, or book well ahead and eat at the Reichstag. Both very good choices.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing - Discriminational service”
Reviews.Author: Athina_Gr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza Berlin Center at the end of April 2011. Besides the really good location, our welcoming and stay were absolutely dissapointing. Having a scheduled flight, arriving late at night, we called one day before to inform the hotel about our late arrival. They thanked us about the information and they ensured us our booking was secure. Arriving at 1am, ill and after a long flight we were informed that "there was a problem with the system" and that they would have to move us to another hotel. Our communication with both the reception employees escalated from bad to worse. One of the receptionists bashed us for our national origin, telling us "we know what's going on in your country. It's more than enough for you to send you in a good hotel for the night". After this, we called the police to file an official complaint against discriminational service. It was the first time in our lives to have such a welcome in a hotel. It was an absolutely disappointing start. All we were wishing for was an apologise and acceptance of the fact that the hotel forwarded our room to another client. This would be understandable. Things like this can happen. Nevertheless, we received racist remarks instead, totally unacceptable for employees in a country having such a past in discrimination. Our stay was also quite dissapointing afterwards. Cleaning personell are constanty bumping the doors to inform you they want to clean the rooms. Cofee facilities in our room are never cleaned ( what's the use to have them there if the cofee cup is never cleaned after you use it? ). This is a very good hotel at a very good location but employees are rude and untrained. One example: We requested information about visiting the Reichstag. Reception ensured us it was impossible to visit until the day of our departure. 20 minutes later we walked by the Reichstag, entered with no problem and enjoyed our visit. Very dissaponting service for a well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: MaryP48
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my partner in feb and was so impressed with the location and service i returned with a group of friends to visit the xmas markets. It's location both for a city visit and xmas markets is perfect. Staff very friendly and helpful, superb breakfast best i've ever got abroad lovley pool to relax in after all the sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: tuitai
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. It is very convenient for shopping as well as sight seeing. It is closed to subway and walking distance to the Zoo (I didn't go there) and Tiergarden. You can buy a Berlin welcome card from the reception that gives you discounts for tours and restaurants. There is a small open market near/behind the hotel where you can have a hot soup or fresh fruit juice for very little. The hotel is clean and the front desk is very helpful. I also get free wi-fi service being a gold member of the Club. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VillanOfBrum
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for a work conference for a week. Excellent hotel both for the business side of things and for the tourist. Great location. Nice sized rooms, comfortable. Good food. Would recommend for both business and leisure visit to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated hotel - poor concierge service”
Reviews.Author: cat_harrell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel very clean, recently remodeled with a fun, hip Berlin vibe and in a good area of town with access to lots of shopping, sites and the park. However, their concierge service was a real let down. I emailed them a full week in advance with a few restaurants where I wanted to possibly have dinner. While the immediately emailed back to say they were on it, when we checked in, no reservations. It got worse throughout the trip, each day when we asked for help with basic questions, the staff either seemed annoyed to have to help or simply didn't have any grasp on the basics in the city. They didn't have an official concierge desk, instead the various front desk staff were (poorly) fielding questions.

Reviews.Title: “A typical Crowne Plaza with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: bigscreen
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location - close to transportation, shopping, zoo/aquarium, restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: DK5179
Reviews.Content: Good location near to all public transportation and shopping centers Very nice staff always ready to assist Nice breakfast Very clean and quiet rooms

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ross1979
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, great location for the shops and sightseeing. had an executive room on the back, very quiet and peaceful, comfortable beds and nice amenities. room could do with a bit of a refurb. only complaints are that you have to pay 7euro to use sauna, and internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Value, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: JNS60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the month of February in Berlin, 10 days at a hotel close by which we did not enjoy and then the next 17 days at Crowne Plaza Berlin. We have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. Everyone in the hotel was friendly and helpful especially when the only language you speak is English. Our room was a nice size, comfortable, always kept clean plus we received the USA Today newspaper (in English) daily, the weather report for the next day and someone always turned our bed down and made the room ready for the night! The morning breakfast was just awesome including the staff members who greeted usand made sure we were enjoying our meal. We are "Priority Point" members,so the hotel gave us upgrades including free internet. The location is wonderful including access to public transportation. Super shopping area, close to the Zoo as well as a few historical artifacts. If you are looking for good value and a friendly atmosphere...............I reccommend you stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Mrbiffo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a city break. The hotel is comfortable and the location is good, near 3 S/U Bahn stations. There are lots of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. My room was on the small side but comfortable. Check in the process was smooth and welcoming and the staff at the hotel were very helpful. Breakfast is served until 1130 on weekends although service in the restaurant during the busy breakfast period was non existent. There is wireless but you must pay an extortionate price of 12 euros per day which is really the only negative point about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that is easy to forget”
Reviews.Author: garyinternational
Reviews.Content: One of the many blah hotels that are around the world. it only has a few good attributes: 1. position - good position in down town Berlin (taxi about 30 Euro to airport ). 2. Decent gym (but you have to pay for the sauna) 3. Wilson's - a good hotel restaraunt Otherwise - slow internet, be careful not to take the "whole communications package" then they will charge you 23 Euro. The staff are not friendly and bark out at you. Otherwise, no conciege to help with site seeing etc. in short - I wont go there again, - nothing spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoscow
Reviews.Content: We stopped for 2 nights in improved number with an additional bed for the child. Room spacious enough and comfortable. An excellent convenient bed, but unfortunately exbed for the child not so convenient. But it is impossible to complain, as the child till 18 years takes place free of charge, including a breakfast. In room good isolation, dressing gowns, a press for trousers and the iron. An excellent and various breakfast. Probably to use the printer in a hall, to unpack the necessary information. But unfortunately the Internet paid and expensive (6 euro/hour). There is a pool and saunas (hadn't time to use). The hotel is located very conveniently to business streets and a zoo. The unique negative was that the hotel without the prevention has blocked the sum equal to cost of residing of night on a credit card. While blocking isn't removed, though full calculation is already made some days ago. In the rest is an excellent hotel at the comprehensible prices.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a real 4 star hotel except for the prices.”
Reviews.Author: tellitlikeitis01
Reviews.Content: My family booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 7 nights over the xmas period which included the buffet breakfast. Checkin was easy but we had to remind them that the rooms were both paid for in full in advance. The rooms are just average and no different from any other square hotel room. For the whole week we were there our bathroom supplies were never replaced (cotton wool, cotton buds) nor was the tissue box refilled in fact one of the bedrooms never had tissues. We kept having to ask at reception for the bathroom stuff. The sheets were never changed and the the plug hole in the sink was filthy, like it should have been cleaned with a toothbrush to really get it clean. The pool area is clean and the pool was cold every time we went to use it and some of the days it was too cold to get into it but we were told it was kept at 28 degrees. You have to pay for the sauna and we were told that is because the sauna is small and if it was free too many people would use it, then why bother having one at all. The gym had everything most people look for. You have to pay to use the internet and to use the computer in the lobby it costs 6 euros for 30 minutes so we went out to use one and paid 50 cents for 20 minutes. The white wine in the bar was 9 euros. The hotel started to fill up towards new years eve and breakfast was served in several rooms and was like standing in a cattle market waiting for a clean table and standing in line to get food, not very plesant first thing in the morning. On our checkout the man said he would do our bills and again I said it was all paid for in advance and we charged no extras to the rooms but he said we made a call for 40 cents which I said we did not so he looked down his nose at me and said he would take it off for me. (big deal) They do not take your bags to the rooms for you nor do they offer to call for a taxi if you want one. The service begins and ends at the reception desk. I was expecting alot more from a 4 star hotel as I usually get more from other ones at the same price which is not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizIreland
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, I always stay here (except on one occasion when it was full) and this was my 7th visit. The location is great - close to the major stores, close to transport and great for getting around the city, lots of restaurants close by. The hotel is really comfortable and most of all, the staff members are great - very friendly and very helpful at all times. I have no complaints whatsoever and always recommend the hotel to my friends. I will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “fair”
Reviews.Author: seekayy
Reviews.Content: i stayed lmost 9 days in the hotel , the location is quite good, the service is not bad although the room and toilet werent that clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Centre location, well equipped but refurbishment would be nice”
Reviews.Author: vivi003
Reviews.Content: Location is great, catered for most shopping needs. Room is average but very clean and fully equipped with business needs; pins for labtop, phone chargers etc. Flat screen TV with over 50 channels is a bonus and much appreciated especially some English channels. The hotel has stopped providing free internet usage at the lobby area, not sure why. Staff are friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good value, has all you need in a great location, but rooms will need a refresh”
Reviews.Author: swisspigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few times at the Crown Plaza City Centre in Berlin because it is a very convenient hotel, just around the corner of the KaDeWe, the large great department store of Berlin, the Kurfürstendamm and the Schöneberg district. We always get a very good deal (price) for this hotel and this makes us coming back. It is great value for money, the sleeping comfort is good, the rooms are what you expect from a larger chain hotel. The bathroom in particular needs a refresh although everything still works to satisfaction. The personnel is great and friendly and we always feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Beginning to look a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Guygud
Reviews.Content: Berlin is one of the most interesting an enthralling cities in Europe, we love it and highly recommend it to everyone. The Crowne Plaza on Nurnberger Strasse has been our choice hotel for a few years now, lots of money has been invested in the foyer, restaurant etc. but the rooms are definately looking tired, the bathroom appeared clean but occasionally had a very unpleasant smell of urine, rather like a public convenience, wafting through it. The staff are very helpful and polite, the pool is small but well maintained, and of course everything is expensive, but all you need to do is step out and go to the Europa Centre for anything you need, Tiffany's does a great Currywurst and chips! We did also eat in the Prime Cut restaurant in the hotel, the portions are typical of today's nouveau cuisine and leaves you wanting more, also very, very expensive! We booked a table for a special occasion and was left with a choice of 2 tables in the main thoroughfare, we then noticed that the Maitre De was offering the nice secluded tables to new (local) customers - I was not impressed as he had told us the tables were reserved. Maybe we just need to find somewhere new, but if you do chose this hotel get the best room you can rather than pay 27e for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Gutten Tag! Centrally located, great to see Berlin staying here!”
Reviews.Author: bobbyramakant
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza is very well located - hardly 5 minutes walk from a train station (underground) and about 10 minutes walk from ZOOLOGICAL GARDEN (zoo) - where there is another metro train station. it is surrounded by many places to eat and get the feel of Berlin including Europa Centre - and there is a very old church next to it which was bombed in world war II and is still there! Do stop by and have a look from inside. ROOMS are very good - very well maintained and stocked! just enough space (not very big, but just like European hotels, is just enough space to walk!). Bathrooms are well stocked too and room service good with chocolates waiting for you on the pillow every night :) The internet is not free - Euros 12.50 for 24 hours is a very expensive. BReakfast is another highlight - seriously. Loved the breakfast here and the number of dishes will surely provide you enough of your favourites! Coffee is so good and I had two cups every day to begin the day at a right level of energy and freshness :) The restaurants in this hotel are very good too - so do enjoy your time here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neerajj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. The location was very convenient because the conference for which I had gone there was at a walking distance. But apart from that too, there were couple of points which made this hotel a good choice for us. the first one was its distance from the airport (tegel). we took a taxi and it doesn't cost more than 20 minutes and 16 euros at any point of time.
