The other good point was the room and the toilet, pretty clean and spacious. the bed and the pillow menu was the most comfy one. the breakfast spread was, even though, same everyday, but it was big enough not to get monotonous (maybe I didn't have time to explore the buffet much). it was close to U-bahn station even though i didn't use it. on the negative side, it was pretty much at a distance from all the happening places and historical sites for which the city is known for. i liked the eastern part more for its multiple flavor and had to stress out to go that far. the zoo was close by but who goes to zoo without kids...

Reviews.Title: “Big but good!”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice for one night with a number of colleages on a short stop over. Booked 6 rooms on the first occasion and 2 on the second. Reason I chose this hotel for our stays was I found a very good prepaid deal on the net. Value for money turned out ot be excellent. Rooms are fairly modern with very comfortable beds and flat screen tvs. Only real point of criticism (next to the room size which is just average) is that the ceiling over the bath tub is rather low. When taking a shower I (1.90m) had bend down a bit in order to wash my hair. As a Platinum member my room was upgraded on the first occasion and both rooms were upgrade on the second stay. I was given free internet as part of an ongoing promotion. Although this is a big conference hotel geared towards the business traveller and maybe tour groups, service was good. Breakfast was also OK. Therefore if you are interested in the western part of the city and manage to grab a good deal, because of its central location there is absolutely no harm in staying at this well-run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location Location”
Reviews.Author: andrit2010
Reviews.Content: Great Location!- if you prefer to stay at West Berlin, this hotel is the best choice!. many shopping centres around the hotel, Europa center, Zara, KaDeWe. only 5 min away from Ubahn. Great selection of Breakfast menu. dinner at the restaurant abit pricey but fantastic food. We booked a junior suite room and all the amenities are what 4 stars hotel got to offer. Checkin and check out are very fastttt. the downside is the internet is not free, you need to pay and it's per equipment ie.. if you want to use your iphone wifi, you need to pay for one log in and another log in for laptop. the hotel is not far from the airport(tegel), only cost around 15-20 euro Make sure you check out the food court at level 6 KaDewe shopping center. it has a fantastic choice of food and great customer service. Hop in and out City bus tour is jsut around the corner on the hotel street. we have been traveling for 3 week and anotehr 3 weeks to go, the hotel receiption girl shown us where the closest Laundromat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: btitle
Reviews.Content: I and two friends stayed at the Hotel Crowne Plaza City Center in Berlin for 8 days. We originally reserved a Junior Suite with 2 bathrooms but when we arrived they gave us two completely separate adjoining rooms. The buffet breakfast was extensive and very good. Hotel staff was most helpful in helping us plan our days and outings. The only problem we encountered was the lack of understanding of the housekeeping staff when we asked for extra pillows and a top sheet instead of a the provided comforter. It took us 2 days to get the sheets to use as a blanket and softer pillows. Suggestion would be to make all requests at the front desk.. Location of the hotel was wonderful for shopping, metro, walking to many sights and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Loadsofit
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here in Sept. 2010. The location is great, near the centre of West Berlin close to the Zoo and the Tiergarten (Berlin's Hyde Park). The rooms were standard, the staff were very friendly and helpful. In all I thought the decor was a little dated, or maybe I've been in too many new hotels lately. Great shopping close by, many flagship stores. All in all I enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Only and only if Crowne Plaza Berlin is fully booked, I would stay at another hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: gezgin_dromedary
Reviews.Content: In the period between 2006 and 2010 I have stayed about 6or 7 times at Crowne Plaza Berlin City Center, the last one being on April 2010. I always returned there as a satisfied and enthusiastic guest. First of all, the Crowne Plaza Berlin fully deserves its title 'City Center'. Located on Nuernbergerstrasse, only within 5 minutes walking distance to Ku'damm, it is literally at the heart of West Berlin. The staff at the reception is almost always very helpful and knowledgeable about any question I had about Berlin's transport, highlights and addresses. The rooms are very modern, clean, and comfortable, and the housekeeping is very friendly. Even though I do not know any of the hotel's management personally, I would like to congratulate them for making my stays at Crowne Plaza Berlin a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor cleaning service”
Reviews.Author: franciscofernandez1
Reviews.Content: I dropped a deodorant cap under the desk, forgot to pick it up first day so I decided to leave it there to see what happened: The cap remained there for three days more!! Breakfast room is incredibly crowded

Reviews.Title: “very good : rooms, breakfast, services, position.”
Reviews.Author: modenese65
Reviews.Content: Very good accomodation. rooms are not very large but very clean, all kind of services available. Breakfast very good, cakes, salad, fruit, eggs, cheese, ecc. Very good position. Good for bus and Ubahn metro. Very good the price for the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: The_Rev007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 rooms with interconnecting door with a double room for my wife and me and a twin room for our twins. This counted as one family room. The rooms were clean, tidy and comfortable. The location was excellent, with shopping and the U-Bahn (public transport system) very close. The breakfast was the same every day, but we got more than enough to do. The staff were very helpful. They all spoke very good English, but appreciated us trying our German! I'm a Priority Club Rewards member and had free internet access for the duration of our stay - a nice bonus. We came away disappointed that we were going home. I can't think of a better recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work but still my choice in its price range”
Reviews.Author: Bywalec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Crown Plaza many times. My comments are based on comparison with other Crown Plaza hotels. The location is perfect: steps away from the famous KaDeWe department store, and the heart of West Berlin and its attractions. Most rooms are now renovated, and the rooms are more than acceptable. This time, we were upgraded and would rate the room overall excellent except for a few irritating flaws: like absence of facial tissues or even a place for any (like a tissue holder). The housekeeping was overall good. Unfortunately, like in many hotels (even the best in Berlin) the housekeeping staff do not report glaring mechanical problems to the supervisors: leaky toilets, hand shower heads, bathtubs plugs that won't pop up etc. They often can't speak English or German for that matter, which makes communication more difficult. The TV was a flat screen and the furnishings modern and functional. Internet was affordable (should be free). In a word the physical plant is more than acceptable. What the hotel falls down on is the human / service aspect: attitude, atmosphere, attention (AAA) There has not been a check out without a problem with the bill, the rate or some other irritant. The check ins are made difficult by lack of reserved stopping area for unloading luggage. Most of the staff at the Front Desk are disinterested, look bored and don't seem to care one bit, in a word hopeless. The invisible Bellman shows up only after you schlep the bags form the curb where the taxi ejected them, to the lobby - and offers to take the bags to the room - expecting a tip of course. If you drive up, expect to to jockey for the unloading spot with the taxis at the stand in front of the hotel and the delivery trucks. Fortunately not all the Front Desk staff fail to impress: one notable exception was Herr Patrick Funke who was effective and caring. The General Manager Frau Winkler should be thankful to have him, and I hope she appreciates her luck! Don't bother with the hotel breakfast: it is not worth it. Head for the Literatur House on Fasanen Strasse or the Berliner Cafe Rosterei on Uhland Strasse (both near Kurfursterdamm) for a delicious breakfast with the best coffee in Berlin (Rosterei). Overall this hotel has potential, and with a dose of good management it can realise it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsTravelg
Reviews.Content: Have stayed a number of times at the Crowne Plaza, the standad of service and the buffet breakfast's still remain good. Bedrooms are comfortable & the evening turndown service is an added bonus. The swimming pool is small and a downside is the extra charge for the sauna. Good location in West Berlin, close to the transport network and the shops along the Kudam & so handy for KaDeWe, the best department store in Europe - the food hall is excellent. We can recommend MORE restaurant on Motzstrasse in the gay quarter. Well worth taking trips out of the city to Potsdam and Sanssouci. Can also recommend the concentration camp at Sachsenhausen - using the Sandeman New Berlin walking tour - excellent guides, meet at Dunkin Donuts outside Zoo Station or at Starbucks by the Bradenburg Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bosak
Reviews.Content: Nice location, close to KaDeWe, metro station (very easy to use) and the most sofisticated commercial street, in front of Europe Center. Nice staff, gorgeous breakfast. The third bed was not so big to my daughter. There are some restaurants nearby, but we loved the Imbiss and the delicatessen at KaDeWe, so it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, fine staf, average amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Odysseaus
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for Medical conference accompanied by my brother, on the first floor. Spacious, sound-proof room, but fridge locked , only for hotel goods - can't use it to cool own stuff! Very disappointing for this class hotel. Didn't change sheets till the third day. Nice bathroom, well air-conditioned room, helpfull staff. Nearby everything. Metro station 2min. walk, KaDeWe stores just by the corner, Kaiser Willhellms Gaedechtniss Kirche 3min. walk ,opposite the zoo entrance. Same breakfast every morning for four days - a little boring... Best location to explore the city. I 'd stay there again in any suitable occasion - brother liked it too!

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable business class hotel, KaDeWe around the corner, KuDam less than 5 mins walk away,zoo 2 mins. walk.”
Reviews.Author: eilslreland
Reviews.Content: Spacious comfortable room. Good clean bathroom with toiletries. In room safe big enough to take a laptop.Room door has security catch in addition to the usual lock. Mini bar had a seal on the door so couldn't be used to hold extras. Room service more or less on time. Internet access connection for laptop available in room and a wireless keypad is provided to access internet via the 32" flatscreen tv, though cost of this was very expensive. Friendly staff. Brilliant location for shopping and close to the vaarious hop on hop off stops. 40min. journey from Schonfeld airport to zoo station €2.80. Taxi to Schonfeld cost €35 Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in commercial area”
Reviews.Author: ShugsCumbria
Reviews.Content: We were a mid to late 60's couple having a three night break in Berlin. The Crowne Plaza is a business orientated hotel in a commercial area and is nothing to look at from outside, but inside it is nicely furnished and decorated. Our room was spacious and well furnished, with a comfortable, queen size double bed. There was an internet access point for a laptop and also a wireless keyboard provided for use with the 32" flat screen television as the monitor. The bathroom was very good and user friendly, with toiletries provided. There was some slight noise from the air conditioning system. The hot part of the buffet breakfast was fine and perfectly satisfactory, while the cold side had extensive choices that would to satisfy anyone. Oddly, we had three breakfasts in three different rooms, depending on how many guests there were. The only slight criticism was that, as you had to seat yourself, the tables could have been cleared a bit quicker. All the staff we came in contact with were friendly and helpful. The hotel facilities are excellent. There is a gym, swimming pool and spa and it is a well used conference centre. We particularly enjoyed the main bar, which was welcoming and comfortable. The hotel is also well provided with lifts. We thought the hotel was very good, but unfortunately, as elderly tourists, we found that it was a little too far, for walking, from the main attractions. It is located right at the south west corner of the Tiergarten park, close to the zoo, while most of what we wanted to see was situated from the Riechstag / Brandenberg Gate area, eastwards. I mention this because we soon found out that Berlin taxis are not cheap, it was 35 euros from Schonefeld airport and the two mile journey from the Brandenberg Gate to the hotel cost 12 euros. We enjoyed Berlin very much and found the evidence of it's dramatic history fascinating. There are plenty of green areas, some very imaginative modern buildings and interesting things to see, as well as an excellent urban transport system. The dome of the Riechstag is well worth a visit but usually means a queue. However, if you are elderly or have young children, you are allowed to bypass the queue and enter through a side door, have a word with the person at the mobile information desk by the queue. It is also worth going into the Hotel Adlon, near the Brandenberg Gate, just for a drink but take your bank book with you ! The Passages in the old jewish quarter are also worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: viajero1228
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after travelling through Denmark and Sweden, what a welcome relief to find a great hotel at a great price. Extremely clean room within easy walking distance from the train station at the zoo. The breakfast was very good, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ymff
Reviews.Content: Room: Clean, cozy. Nice large windows running the length of the room. Well lit. Bed: Very clean and comfortable. Safe: Good size - I was able to put my laptop in it. Bathroom: Medium sized. Hot water. Well lit. Pool: Very clean but small. Could only do short laps. Warm water. Pool attendant was extremely helpful. Breakfast: Good buffet selection. Room Service: Fast, good food quality.

Reviews.Title: “I will come there again!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaPneum
Reviews.Content: I lodged at the Crowne Plaza Hotel City Center in Berlin for 2 nights with my husband in February 2010 for a work meeting and I felt very well in this hotel. It is located in a central area in Berlin, near to the department store KaDeWe, the Nike Town (in the corner) and the most popular boulevard Kurfurstendamm. You can reach the U-bahn Augsburger and Wittenbergpl. in only 5 minutes on foot. My double room (359 at the third flat) was very comfortable, spacious, warm, with a big bed and soft bathrobes! The only lack was the blanket too short (so during the night you can loose it while outside there are -10 C!). The breakfast was moderate, with variety of food. I don't like very much the dinner and the lunch (maybe it was the german cooking, for me no tasty). The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a fitnesscentre with swimmingpool, but I didn't use them. The internet service was in room for pay. The minibar was locked, so you can'tuse it for fridge your owne bottles... The hotel is a good quality one, with a little old furniture, but very comfortable! Especially I suggest it for his location! I will come there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: LoulouQC
Reviews.Content: My review would be closer to a 4.5 in actuality. The rooms were well-appointed and the beds were comfortable. The staff was very friendly and happily answered all of our questions. We were there during the World Track and Field Championships and the hotel was all decked out for it, which was a nice touch. The location was great, close to public transportation and there was plenty of shopping and food within a short walk. The swimming pool and fitness area were also nice and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “A good quality hotel with welcoming and knowledgeable staff.”
Reviews.Author: johnny_c-l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find and located just next to Kurfürstendamm shopping district and the famous KaDeWe and also the Europa Centre. The Kaiser-Wilhem-Gedächtnis-Kirche is just a few minutes walk away and especially nice for the Christmas Market. The nearest U-Bahn station is Wittenbergplatz, and nearest S-Bahn station is Zoologischer Garten. Check-in was quick and friendly, as all staff were throughout my stay. The room was quite spacious and with classical-style decor; I was provided with complimentary mineral water in the room. The TV was a modern flatscreen Samsung, and the room had a writing desk and separate coffee table and chair. The bathroom felt a little clinical and basic compared to the room, but the shower had good pressure and the bathroom was spacious. Housekeeping and turndown service was good, although the sheets did not appear to have been changed between my first and second night and I felt the room could have been vacuumed better. Room service was excellent - friendly, prompt and well-priced food. The evening restaurant was quiet when I ate but had a relaxed atmosphere and staff were keen to recommend dishes. The buffet breakfast was a typical wide German selection of meats/cheeses/breads/eggs etc. Overall my stay was very good, the staff were friendly and very keen to help and the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose, smallish room, no issues just average.”
Reviews.Author: Doyzer
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay, second floor room, maybe I should have rated the Crowne Plaza Dubai at 4. In CP Berlin the rooms are quiet small, staff are good and friendly, but nothing to separate this from any other city hotel. I’d try another Hotel if I visited Berlin again, but just for comparison, nothing really wrong with this Hotel, you can hear TV's in other rooms, and some noise, it was not really hot, so the poor AC was not an issue. Good location, but nothing attractive in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarthaAhtens
Reviews.Content: It is a nice central hotel with excellend transportation option. You can find may shops, cafes, restaurants on walking distance. KADEWE is very close. The hotel is a bit '80 style. the room I stayed was clean, spacious with many complimantary bathroom goodies. Large beds also. It had neither free internet access nor breakfast and both of the were expensive to buy. We has excellend breakfasts to neayby cafes though and we didn't really needed any internet access since we were on vacations. I would stayed there again

Reviews.Title: “Much better after complaining!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHNearBirmingham
Reviews.Content: What a difference the second time around! After our first visit in early Sept we twice wrote & complained to the hotel highlighting our very poor experiences at this hotel. The first message got no response or even acknowledgement. So I wrote again saying that I was disappointed but not surprised to have heard nothing back from them., I then got a call from the Front of House Manager who was most apologetic, and offered to upgrade our room if we visited again, which did a few weeks later in late Sept 2009. This time around we were met by the Front of House Manager, were upgraded to an Executive suite, given complimentary champagne and boxes of chocolates too. Contrary to our previous visit, this time the room was flawlessly clean, better fittings, the air conditioning worked, and was kept in a well maintained state throughout our 4 day stay here. Best of all we paid only for 2 nights at the standard room rate due to the extent of our previously poor experience. I can only say that after complaining, all the stops were pulled out to ensure that our second visit was a far better experience than the first. I would now consider using the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard, great service, very central location”
Reviews.Author: CP0801
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers the standard expected froma crown plaza hotel. Everything is just fine, great central location. Rooms to the street need and have ! isolating windows. Breakfast is very good with lots of fresh fruit, different kind of bread, juices, eggs, cheese etc etc. Friendly service. All this for a very fair price. Definitely recommendable

Reviews.Title: “Elegant business hotel in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: GGlen78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently placed just off the Kufurstendam. It is right in the middle of what was the heart of West Berlin. The breakfast is lavish, as it usually is in German hotels. The room was spacious and elegant. Conference facilities were top-notch, all AV equipment was up-to-date. What looked like a couple of hookers were hanging out at the bar every night, something I've not seen anywhere else I've stayed in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin we loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sanfairyann
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week in Germany, first stop Hambourg, lovely place, the husband went to the model railway museum and would highly recommned to enthusiasts. We stayed in Berlin at the Crowne Plaza hotel , 3 minutes from the Zoo, lovely hotel, superbly clen and verty friendly, excellent towels and bedding, all very comfortable. We would highly recommend the FAT TIRE TOUR, this is a tour of Berlin with a group of people and a guide on mountain bikes! Not to be missede and worth the 20 euros per person. The TV Tower is a great way to see 0ver the city, however if you go to the revolving restaurant for coffee and cake don't go after 4.30 PM as they are setting for dinner and the service is slow and very poor! In the Europa centre you will find plenty of different eateries and shops, there is also an Irish puvb and not for the faint hearted Mondays is an entertaining karaoke night. There are plenty of restaurants near this hotel and all very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: LilacBlossom9
Reviews.Content: The area the hotel is in is excellent; lively but not too noisy at night, excellent for finding nearby bars and shops, not quite so brilliant for sightseeing, but you can get a cheap all day bus ticket and you can get to these within quarter of an hour. The communal areas of the hotel all appear to be recently renovated and the restaurant for the buffet breakfast was excellent; probably the best I've seen. My only real gripe was the room itself. We booked a superior double room and got what was probably a standard room which was annoying; the room was meant to have a bath and didn't, we got a twin rather than a double. We found the air conditioning was useless and the room was very hot and stuffy, opening the window didn't really help as the traffic noise was so loud and the windows hardly opened at all either. Also the room was really small; there was one of the most enormous wardrobes I've ever seen in a city hotel, pointlessly taking up about a third of the room, making the space feel unnecessarily cramped. Still, the beds were comfortable, it was clean and city was amazing so you can overlook such irritations really!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iulia17
Reviews.Content: The room was terrible: small, dusty, the king size bed was very small, everything was old: TV, furniture, the carpet was dirty, the walls not so clean also, and above all this it was an awful smell in the room and in the bathroom too! I did'n like the room, the hotel need urgent some renovation, looks like a 3 stars hotel, not like a 4 stars superior! The area ie very nice, maybe the best area from Berlin, and the breakfast is very good! I will never come back at this hotel, I didn't like it, it's expensive for what it offers!

Reviews.Title: “Shopping district, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: rueverhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June. The area was great if you want shopping. The rooms were clean and tidy. Even though we were not there in the heat of summer, the rooms were still hot. The ac supposedly worked, but could not cool down the room, luckily we were able to open the window at night to let the cool air in. Our reservation included free wifi. After ringing the desk to ask about this was given a fairly rude, and not complete explanation of how to do this. Still could not get on so paid for a session. Next day went down and spoke to the only polite one at reception and was explained that yes we are to pay for the sessions and they will just wipe them off our account. We had a few tries for different things at reception and mainly the answer was short and curt. The room cleaners and room service staff were the politest of all. Even the bar manager, when you went in and expected service was like you were interrupting him from doing his job. We are Gold Priority Club members, and have stayed at many Holiday Inns & Crowne Plazas and usually get better service than this. Even on leaving there was no Thank you for staying with us. If I was in Berlin again, I would try a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “An excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyboy
Reviews.Content: Officially rated 4 stars superior, this is indeed a superior hotel with bright and airy fair-sized rooms which are very comfortably furnished. Good beds, choice of pillows, lots of wardrobe and storage space, tea/coffee-making facilities, iron and ironing board, trouser press and electronic safe and all well maintained. The bathroom was well equipped and had personal choice hot water temperature controls for bath and shower and a nice selection of toiletries. Bath towels, however, were modest in size. Breakfast buffet offered an excellent range of fresh fruits and juices and hot and cold dishes. Staff throughout the hotel were friendly and efficient. Only 2 minutes from the famous KaDeWe department store and Kurfuestendamm, and situated midway between Wittenbergplatz and Zoologischer Garten stations 4 minutes away, the hotel could not be more conveniently located. This will certainly be our first choice should we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL - VERY GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: MAROAthens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Berlin in early May 2009 and stayed in Crown Plaza for five nights. This was our second stay in this hotel (our first being in January 2005). The Crown Plaza is a nice hotel and very well located in the west part of the city (it is in the middle of a vast shopping area). The metro and bus stations are very close and around the hotel you will find a lot of places to eat and/or drink. Our room and bathroom on the seventh floor were clean, comfortable and of adequate size. The breakfast buffet offers an extensive variety of food and it was the best we had in all over Germany. We also used the room service and it was very good too and reasonably priced. Crown Plaza’s staff could not be better. They were helpful, polite and professional. We can recommend the hotel to our friends and we would return for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Foodfan617
Reviews.Content: Great room, well put together public areas and very tasteful decorations in the bar and restaurants. Inclusive breakfast was true German style, simply excellent. Fitness Center had a few basic nautilus machines, treadmill, and the pool and staff were very helpful. Pool + fitness in basment, pool was very small. In relation to things: Two long blocks (5-7 minutes) from the destroyed church and another short hop to the Zoologischer Garten station. Many many city tours meet at that station and there are especially interactive ones that we chose with InsiderTours...try the Cold War Tour...and the neweurope free tour. My mother did not like the latter as it is geared towards the college crowd but it got us through the city quite nicely. Avoid? -- the square of the destroyed church after midnight if you do not feel safe in new cities or feel you stand out, the people were not the best crowd, but it is a public space, you shouldn't get accosted. Around? -- Excellent restaurant alley about five minutes towards the station, the zoo is right there, and of course Ka De We, the Harrods of Berlin. We could see it from our window. Go! good location, good four star quality for money, great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value , friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 1pp
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin Germany April 1-7 ,2009. I stayed at the Crown plaza city center hotel. The hotel was clean, with a friendly helpful staff who could not do enough for us to make our stay pleasurable. Wonderful breakfast, worth the extra fee. Tip: Buy the Berlin Travel Passcard and the Museum card both are well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great service, hotel located in central shopping district”
Reviews.Author: SallyGirl81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights as part of my Euro trip with a cousin in early April. We were both very impressed with the hotel. Rooms were very small (we each had enough space on the floor to spread out a suitcase each next to the bed), but kept clean. Complimentary coffee, tea and a bottle of water were waiting in the room for us. Great turn down service after dinner. We were told when booking with Holiday Inn hotels that wi-fi would be free. However, we were charged maybe 5 euros for 30 minutes (roughly), just be sure to use it all at once, the minutes don't continue the next time you log in. Didn't use the steam room, or try breakfast at the hotel as it was very expensive ($30ish for a hot breakfast). Front desk girls (English speaking) were more than willing to give us maps and directions to area attractions, and were generally very helpful. We got to check our bags in to a holding room upon arrival, and came back around noon to find out a room was ready for us (two hours early). This hotel is located just a block away from Kurfustendamm shopping and KaDeWe on one side, the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial and Berlin Zoo a couple blocks away on the other side. It's located right between two u-bahn stations, which are both just a couple of blocks away. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: bendheim
Reviews.Content: Smallish rooms that have not been redecorated for a while, but very clean and comfortable are hallmarks of this hotel. Coffee in the room, nice linen, and cosy is the overall feel. Great location just near Wittenbergplatz U-bahn and just a skip away from K'Dam and all the big stores. Very comprehensive hot and cold buffet for breakfast as part of a great deal that will have me returning again next time in Berlin. Functional rather than romantic, but nicely functional and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dumont78
Reviews.Content: Comparatively speaking, this hotel is reasonably priced, but they do "nickel and dime" you to death. For example, the pool is free (and small), but the sauna is an extra 7.50 euro. WiFi is 12 euro per day in your room, or if you don't have a laptop, the business center is 6 euro per 15 minutes of use! That said, the rooms and entire hotel are immaculate. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are nice. Since this is a US chain, you'll find a US electric outlet in the bathroom and an iron and ironing board in the closet, which you won't get at most other Euro hotels. The location is pretty convenient, although very touristy.

Reviews.Title: “we...loved it........!!”
Reviews.Author: steve314aa
Reviews.Content: excellent... great location.... great breakfast... great rooms.... helpfull stuff !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nancy Greece / Crowne Plaza Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: GreeceNancy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CROWNE PLAZA for 5 nights just before Christmas time. Although we had some concerns because of some reviews at the end we were really satisfied that we stayed there. It was a great value of money !! The breakfast wonderfull, the staff very polite and friendly, the location perfect, and the rooms clean and cozy. The only negative I must underline is that for 5 nights we stayed our bed sheets were not changed. That was a disapointment but all the rest were really great.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Markets”
Reviews.Author: CollinsNI
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Berlin, we stayed at the 4* Crowne Plaza. The Hotel was great, the buffet was excellent with a choice of fruits, hams cheeses, breads and hot buffet of bacon, eggs - boiled or scrambled local sausages and pork meatballs (like white pudding). The rooms were clean. The service excellent, most of the staff spoke english and if they didn't they found staff that did. In the area we were beside Ka Da We shopping centre - like Harods, and another shopping centre with resturants, bars etc, again all the shops had someone who spoke English, all the resturants and the menu in English. The markets were right beside us with various stalls of food, drink, candles, hats, toys, handmade tree ornaments etc. I would definately go back. I would recommend the public transport - we ot a 2 day pass in ABC area as our airoport was in area C. We took the city bus tour with English speaking guide, this was good as we found our bearings and seen where alot of the markets were. Very good trip, good good and good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: NorthernRiversNSW
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Crowne Plaza on a recent 4-week trip in Europe. Our executive room was located on the top floor and was quiet as it faced away from the street. It wasn't of the usual standard found in an executive room with the Crowne Plaza brand. The room was clean however it was quite small and everything about it was out-dated and very average. This was our first trip to Berlin and we found the location of the hotel to be very convenient for tourists. The staff were particularly friendly, professional and helpful and combined with the convenient location, we left with a relatively good impression of the hotel despite the very average accommodation. Next time we would probably try somewhere else though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MakePieNotwar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza, Berlin for 3 nights whilst on a city break. The staff were extremely friendly, always willing to help and most, if not all, had a high standard of English. My room was on the sixth floor (which had a pleasant scent of peach), it was clean and comfortable and the TV had three English channels (CNN, BBC and Sky) as well as other channels in French, Spanish and Italian (and obviously German!) The location of the hotel was excellent- it's only a short walk from the KaDeWe (huge shopping centre), the Kaiser Wilheim Gedachtniskirche, the zoo and the Europa Centre. There's also a taxi rank outside if you want to go anywhere else in the city [but be careful- the Taxis in Berlin are not cheap!] The only meal I had in the Hotel was Breakfast. It's buffet style and there is a lot to chose from, including different types of breads, meats, cereals, fruit and juices. The only complaint I have about the hotel is the prices [i.e The Bar, business centre etc..] It's almost €4 for a glass of orange juice in the bar, and a usage time of 15 minutes on the Internet in the business centre costs €6! Overall, I was satisfied with my stay in the Crowne Plaza and would stay there again if I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkg66
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. The rooms were incredibly tiny; not enough room for two people. Good location, good breakfast, good staff, nice lobby, but THE ROOMS ARE TOO SMALL.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dana_SF
Reviews.Content: I went here on business. The conference was at the hotel, and my wife came along so we could have some fun and experience Berlin together. We were given a room on the first floor (#153), and it was well appointed, with a very comfortable bed, new TV, refrig/minibar, desk, bathrobes, and a nice bathroom (white tile walls, gray granite counter, new Grohe fixtures which were very nice). The room felt like it had been updated in recent years, and it was quite comfortable. It was also extremely quiet. It was a nonsmoking room, and did not smell of stale smoke (as so many "non-smoking" rooms often do). The staff at this hotel were universally helpful, polite, and eager to please.The breakfast every morning was fantastic: way more choices than I am used to: it felt very extravagant. The location is quite good: directly in between the zoo and the Kudam shopping district, with the crown jewel being the KaDeWe department store. The latter is an absolutely huge, mind boggling shopping experience, with 2 entire floors devoted to food and drink (we had several meals at the top-floor restaurant there). Overall, I highly recommend this hotel, and I would definitely stay there again. Tip: buy the 3 day museum pass: its a great deal, and it gets you into most museums.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast and staff saves the day”
Reviews.Author: ynguy
Reviews.Content: A 1970 hotels which is in need of renovation and so far they have redone floors 7 through 4. Work has started on floors 3 through 1 and I was told that renovation of the lobby and food and beverage outlets will also start this year. As mentioned by other reviewers location pretty good and near the tourist bus lines 100 and 200. All rooms in this hotel are the same small size. If one is a light sleeper try to take a room in the back of the house as no street noise. Breakfast service and offering was excellent. In the basement of the hotel is a pool and fitness club and one pays € 7.50 for entrance to the sauna area except when one is member of Priority Club ( from basic to platinum ). This was confirmed by a duty manager. If you do not mind the tiny rooms than an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone keen to please”
Reviews.Author: Canoldir
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Crowne Plaza Berlin whilst visiting the Christmas Markets and other sites. It is very handily placed for the main transport infrastructure near Zoo station and especially the excellent No 100 and 200 buses. Buy a Welcome card for 15 euros ( 48 hours) and you will easily recoup your expenses on travel and some other amenities. Everyone at the hotel was very keen to please and the service was outstandingly good. We could not fault the hotel room, reception and cleaning staff, breakfast facilities etc in any way - everything was first class. It was a pleasure to stay at the Crowne Plaza and we would thoroughly recommend it. The taxi from Tegel airport to the hotel ( and return ) was 15 euros - very reasonable. It took about 20 minutes. We would recommend a city bus tour at 15 euros each for a 2 hour bus journey round the main sites - hop on and off all afternoon. We got on at Brandenburg Gate and returned there, although there are 15 stops altogether. Another bonus for us was the self service restaurant on the 5th floor of the Galerie department store in Alexander Platz. Superb choice of food, help yourself and very good value. They have a great children's area ( Stieff teddy bears etc) on the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manuel6b
Reviews.Content: Staff very nice. Breakfast was good. Room was comfortable but above all it is in a very central location. Easy walk to the KaDeWe, Kaiser Welhelm Church, Ku'damm, Zoo and the Zoo railway station. There, you can find a McDonalds and a Dunkin Donuts. A bike hire place is only a street away. €15 per day was the rate at this location but we found it great to travel across the large (but flat!!) city. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Jim
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for a 4 night break. It was up to the standard we expect of these hotels – clean, comfortable and the food was fine, judged over breakfast each day, 1 room service meal and one lite bite in Pinte, one of the hotel bars. However, the rooms were a bit smaller than expected. We had a room overlooking the rear of the building, and it was fine and quiet, even with the window open. The front of the hotel looks out into the street, so if traffic noise does disturb you ask for a back room, although the double glazing seemed effective. We found the staff to be very helpful, polite and efficient, with nothing ever too much trouble. The hotel was well located both for local facilities such as shopping along the Ku’Dam, restaurants and bars as well as access to public transport – both the S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations were convenient. I could not believe how efficient the public transport actually was – we went to a Genesis concert at the Olympiastadion where at least 70000 people were in attendance, yet there was absolutely no problem with getting there or coming back. An amazing experience (as was the concert!). As an aside, make sure you buy a Berlin Welcome Card either from Tourist Information or the hotel. This provides unlimited travel on all means of public transport for the duration you buy as well as discounts (typically 25% to 50%) at dozens of things such as top tourist attractions, museums, theatres, restaurants etc. There’s even one for Pinte – one of the Crown Plaza bars where you can get 25% discount on your food and drink bill! The leisure suite was quite pleasant – again spotlessly clean and a reasonably sized swimming pool for a hotel. You have to pay extra to use the sauna, though. The only minor gripe was the fact that the cleaning staff seemed a little too enthusiastic to perform their task; there was little gap between knocking on the door and entering. Message is to keep the lock on the door from inside – they even disregarded the ‘do not disturb’ sign on one occasion. Overall, we thought this hotel represented good value for money, and if we ever return to Berlin, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sprinkle_Nor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is has a great locasion in the city centre of Berlin, but that´s the only thing that´s great about it. We stayed there for 3 days and did not feel welcome at all. The staff was unfriendly and not helpful at al. The rooms are old and needs to be renovated. I would not recommend the food and it felt like we where not welcome in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: casswife
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Berlin over the New Year period and whilst there were no major complaints it was definitely uninspiring and not worth the money we paid!! On the positive side, the situation of the hotel was good - a few yards from the Ku-dam and the Zoo. However, the tariff we paid was £690 for 3 nights for 2 rooms and there was not even breakfast included at this price. The bar prices were horrendous, even by hotel standards. The concierge seemed to be absent most of the time when we were looking for advice and we didn't find the reception staff particularly helpful. The room sizes were no bigger than a Holiday Inn or even Holiday Inn Express which would have provided very similar services to what we got and for a lot less money. We approached the reception staff and requested that at least we ought to have had a buffet breakfast included for what we were paying but they weren't in the least bit interested and made this fact quite plain. On the whole, the hotel was clean though we had biscuit crumbs under our bed on arrival (I noticed because I accidentally kicked my slipper under the bed) and they were still there when we checked out - it wasn't a major problem as far as cleanliness is concerned but again for the price we paid it ought not to have happened. We use the ICH chain a lot during our travels but this experience has definitely put us off using the more "expensive & upmarket" part of the chain as it does not represent good value. We wrote to ICH on our return and they have credited our Priority Rewards account with 500 points for our dissatisfaction - this has been accepted by us but for 2 rooms and 4 people we feel this goes nowhere near to making us feel any better towards the rate or our treatment or our intent to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: coysh
Reviews.Content: I have been to Berlin a number of times in the last 15 years and have stayed in this hotel 4 times. The quality has been constantly good. Check in / out very efficient. Rooms very clean although they have the same furnishings they had the first time I visited. It has had a bit of a make over but could do with a serious refit. To bring it up to the same level of some of the more modern hotels that have recently opened. On the plus side it has a descent free swimming pool and gym which many of the new hotels lack. The reason I stayed in here this time is the location. If you want to visit this part of Berlin very near Zoo and just off the Kurfuerstendamm which is still a very important shopping and entertainment street with a wide selections of bars, restaurants, cinemas and theaters then this is a covenant hotel with good facilities especially when you factor in the price under a 100 euros a night for a good room including breakfast for 2 that offers a lot of choice. I am surprised at some of the comments about being some way from the Metro as it is only a 120 Meters walk to the nearest called Wittenbergplatz but I prefer the buses the number 1 or 2 run every 5-7 minutes and take you very quickly to Utter Der Linden / Reichstag which is 3km away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnLee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Crowne Plaza over Thanksgiving. Since everyone was trying to travel within North America for the holiday, it was low season and a terrific deal. Unfortunately we had to leave the day the Christmas Markets opened but we had a great time anyway. The hotel is centrally located, walking distance to the KaDeWe, good restaurants and the zoo. The zoo is well worth a days visit. I have stayed in more luxurious Crowne Plazas but there was nothing wrong with this one. The staff was friendly and the buffet breakfast had literally something for everyone. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel But Not Central Enough”
Reviews.Author: HamburgerMan
Reviews.Content: First stay at this hotel for one Saturday night on a leisure trip. Hotel standard was good, clean, functional with a few nice touches (robes, free sweets in room). Hotel has pool and fitness suite but we did not use this (too busy sightseeing). Our room rate was 101 Euro, booked direct on Holiday Inn website. Not too bad considering class of hotel. However, it is not in a great location, the Zoo area of Berlin is dirty and uninspiring with concrete buildings all around. It is close to KaDeWe department store, and about 5-10 mins walk to the nearest U-Bahn, and 10 mins to Zoo station (which is no longer the main station in Berlin now the new Hauptbahnhof is open). Closer are bus stops on most major routes through Berlin. Staff are friendly enough, but the cocktail / piano bar is outrageously priced (they have a 1/2 price happy hour at 6pm that is nearer normal Berlin bar prices). Better take a walk to a pub nearby! It is ideal if you are renting a car as the main rental companies (hertz, Sixt, Avis etc. are based in the Europa centre car park across the road. A capable, if uninspiring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: Saral
Reviews.Content: Its the second time we have stayed here and will stay again. Its very convenient for Zoo station, and the U-bahn at the opposite end of the street! Its an excellent location for KuDams shops, in fact it couldn't be better. The hotel itself is in a quietish street just off KuDam, it has quite a large lobby, with a bank of pleasant staff waiting to check you in or answer questions, check in was very quick and they had noted each of our requests and read these back to us which was a surprise as most hotels don't take much notice. There were 4 lifts so you never had to wait. The hallways look recently renovated, all floors had an ice machine and shoe shine machine! The rooms aren't massive but large enough for the time you spend in them. We had a twin room with 2 single beds, a writing desk and chair, easy chair and small table, plenty of draw space, a TV with a lot of channels, a mini bar and a good sized wardrobe, with 2 large robes for going to the 'pool The bathroom was spotless and a good size, plenty of toiletries, towels and a good shower. We had breakfast included, which was a help yourself buffet, with a cold salad come chilled fish area? then hot dishes, bacon, egg, sausage, etc then a cold area, cereals, many different jams, 5 different yoghurt dishes, fresh fruit salad, pears, rolls, croisants, danish pastries, small slices of cake, sliced bread and a toaster and finally a whaffle maker - do it yourself with instructions! Coffee was brought to your table and a jug left, many different Teas, and 4 fruit juices. The pool isn't massive but big enough, with loungers to sit on beside the pool, there is also a well equipped gym, and sauna area. Overall I highly recommend this hotel it is really well situated for the shops! and well connected to all transport systems. P.S. shop around for a good price which includes breakfst if at all possible, don't believe as it says on the hotels website that they are guaranteed cheapest as we saved 50 Euros booking through someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CuriousKaren
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel. Only stayed for one night but will certainly stay here again. I got a good rate on the hotel.de website which included breakfast. After staying at a lot of smaller, traditional hotels during our stay in Germany, this was a modern and pleasant change. Buffet breakfast was excellent, room was clean and a good size, and all staff seemed helpful and genuinely friendly. The location was great also - just around the corner from the Zoo Station.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Hotelwatcher
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel and can easily recommend it. The staff are always helpful and polite and warm to you even more if you attempt to speak German. Room was an excellent standard and spotless. Large breakfast selection to choose from. The location of this hotel is superb with easy access to just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Merox
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in order to visit the Christmas markets in Berlin. The first thing that strikes you as you enter the hotel is the cigarette smoke from guests sitting in the foyer. This at the very least should be a non-smoking area. The staff were sometimes helpful and sometimes not. The room was average with a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom. TV channels were limited and air-conditioning noisey. Floors are accessed via five large fast lifts. Breakfast was very good with a vast choice of food but too bad if you need an extra knife or spoon because the cutlery is well hidden and don't expect your breakfast to still be there when you get back if you go searching for anything. Unfortunately for us the night we chose to stay for dinner the hotel was staging a very limited "Italian" themed night. The lack of people eating there should have warned us. The regular hotel patrons obviously knew better. The hotel bars are seriously in need of modernisation. The seating in the "Pinte" bar is worse than the local underground trains and extremely uncomfortable. The piano bar is not much better with leather stools from the 1960's. Both bars are extortionate and again very smokey. The lobby area is inhabited by a few worn-out chairs so, as a place of relaxation, not very inviting. Best to go out in the evenings. The hotel is well situated for the nearby markets, shopping and main-line station Zoologicher Garten. Although we enjoyed our weekend the reason we booked the Crowne Plaza was because we had stayed in the Crowne Plaza in Cologne last year. This hotel needs a lot of money spending on it to bring it up to the same standard and it needs to sort out it's abysmal smoking policy.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a bit long in the tooth?”
Reviews.Author: JimBeam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights in October, and was slightly disappointed overall. I'm not sure how long it has been since the last renovation, but my room seemed to have experienced quite a few years without any new furniture/carpeting etc. The door to the hallway had quite a gap under it, which also added to a less than satisfactory appearance. The bathroom was ok at least, and the bed was also comfortable. As usual (unfortunately) the TV had just CNN and BBC World for english-speakers, it would have been nice in a 4-star hotel to have a few more channels. On the positive side, all the staffmembers I met were friendly and helpful. The location is also great, five minutes walk from Bahnhof Zoo, two minutes from KaDeWe. I paid 120 Euro/night, and found this to be too high for what I got. If I find an offer for around 80-90 I might consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location in berlin”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the summer sale rate of 90 euros, which was very good value. Well situated for tourism, within five minutes walk of the U bahn and plentiful bus services; a five minute stroll to the K'Damm. Pleasant welcome and efficient check-in. Spacious foyer with comfortable seating. The buffet brealfast was good and plentiful. Carpeted corridors and well-equipped, though compact, rooms. Though we asked for a non-smoking room, none was available on arrival. The room we had was actually designated non-smoking on the door though it was obviously designated otherwise by reception staff and smelt dreadful, accordingly. There is some traffic noise from the street outside if the window is opened. Food at the Pinte Bar, and service, was excellent and relatively good value for a hotel of this rating in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Dave148
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CP for six nights. We found the best rate (including breakfast) on their own website. The location makes it wasy to get around Berlin. It's a short walk to the Zoogarten train station along with numerous bus stops. Great shopping and dining choices within easy walking. Breakfast was top notch. The pool was smallish, but nice. As noted in the previous reviews, the air conditioning in the room wasn't able to keep up with the 80+ degree outside temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly, helpful staff. Located near U-bahn subway for convenient access to all of Berlin. Ku'damm shopping, zoo, Kasier Wilhelm Memorial Church and numerous restaurants are all within a half-block. Downside was very expensive breakfast and air-conditioning that cannot keep up with 80+ degree weather. Would recommmend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic choice!”
Reviews.Author: ocr
Reviews.Content: Stayed there mid April for three nights at an excellent rate off Crowne Plaza's own web site. Room was excellent, as was the bathroom, especially with the piped TV. Staff super efficient, and friendly, without being obtrusive. Nice bar for a late drink. Breakfast was among the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had with an amazing choice of everything. Spotlessly clean rooms and public areas. Location is superb, two minutes from KaDeWe and P&C, and just a few minutes from Ku'Damm. Also nicely placed for the No.100 bus which runs directly between East and West. A fair number of restaurants in the vicinity. Recommended for business and leisure customers. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on business for 3 nights, and found the hotel excellent. The staff though stern were very friendly and helpful, the room I had overlooked the main steet outside the entrance, but was not particularly noisey. The resteraunt and bar food was also very good, as were the conference facilities. The location was spot on, just close enough to the hub of the city, but far enough away not to be disturbed by the city life. I managed to walk through the city to many of the attractions (check point Charlie, Brandenberg gate, Jewish monument, shops etc etc), highly recommend the city and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LLion
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location is excellent. It is close to the main train station. It is also less than a block away from the major shopping areas of Berlin. There are a fair number of restaurants in and near the hotel. It is also close to public transport and a taxi to Tegel airport is less than 20 Euros if there isn't much traffic. The staff were quite helpful and made a number of very positive suggestions. Service in the bars and restaurants was also excellent. The rooms were fine but a bit small. The room size was more consistent with a very small German hotel. The room was equiped with a trouser press, an ironing board and iron, minibar, table, chairs, desk and chair. It was also well lit with a big window. Thank God for the window because my number one complaint about the room was the stifling heat. I slept every night without any covers and kept the window open to try to cool it off. One might expect this in summer but this was April and it was relatively cold and rainy outside. The room was equiped with an air conditioner that did little more than help circulate excessively hot air around the room. To be fair, I didn't complain about the heat probably because I was always in a hurry and spent little time in the room. The hotel was a fairly inexpensive compared to other hotels in a similar class. The reservation was made through an international website and there were no problems at all checking in our checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graysgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights stay at this hotel. As usual looked at Trip Advisor first and previous reviews are a bit varied, which always intrigues me. Bluntly, it is formulaic and not full of character. but for what you get it is very good value. I booked direct on the net and got a decent price (av Euro 110 per night including tax, but then add Euro 17.50 for breakfast) for a 4 star central Berlin hotel, and what they term an "Executive" room (so a mini bar, coffee/tea maker, trouser press, iron and ironing board, decent desk and arm chair and dressing gowns plus lots of toiletries - but no in room safe deposit box). Room was spotless and comfortable. Away from the road, 5th floor, and very peaceful - in fact I could not believe I was in the centre of Berlin just a few hundred metres from Zoo station and the Zoo itself (although there was a very minor noise issue - see below!). It was good for work, and the location would make it good for a pleasure trip too. Quibbles (but not really negatives) - a/c not that efficient on a warm spring day so I opened the window and although there was no traffic or people noise, and no noise from adjacent rooms, there was a very noisy family of sparrows that woke me up at 5 in the morning (quite a nice problem compared with many hotels though) Reception staff are a bit impersonal but did speak a variety of languages well - and a couple of staff were really helpful. I had to use the business centre - Euros 5.50 for 15 mins, plus a Euro a page to send a fax (remember that old technology? But when your laptop has problems there still is no other option) Breakfast staff a bit variable too - initially slow to offer coffee - but slightly overzealous when they cleared my paper and food one morning when I went to get some more toast - but were equally rapid and extremely apologetic in retrieving my paper and providing fresh coffee when I arrived back at my table and they immediately realised what had happened. Positives - comfy room, clean and well appointed. Delicious and extensive breakfast buffet (not as good as Bayerischer Hof in Munich or Hilton in Korea, but better than most others at this price point) - very fresh produce and lots of choice - from the very healthy to the very calorie/carb laden. The exec rooms include a turn down service, free mineral water, night time chocs and a sachet of sweets. Plenty of hot water, (but slightly noisy plumbing for the over bath shower). BEST of all, as another reviewer has noted, that wonderful facility where the sound from the telly is piped into the bathroom - I love hotels with that. Would definitely stay there again. I don't think it would be that good for young families though. More a business/ couples location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 day visit to Berlin and really enjoyed this hotel. They have an excellent breakfast ! The pool is nice and the service is great. The only reason why I won't book this hotel the next time I visit Berlin is that I want to see more hotels :) I really would recommend this hotel to anyone ! The location is very nice, close to the Zoologischer Garten Bahnof and near the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Austere Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid-week in a standard room. When asking by telephone what the difference is between a standard and a king bed room, I was told the advantages of a king bed excecutive room. Of course the very friendly receptionist gave me what I paid for (those the difference between two twins and that king bed at the website was considerable) - a standard room. It was on 3rd floor and showed to the back side. Since there is a building in the yard, 3rd floor is the minimum floor level if you want some view. I would agree with all the other users saying that the rooms are smallish but well equiped. The bathroom is a bit small, too. It proved to be a real business hotel and thus the atmosphere was rather austere. The breakfast room was dark, small tables and the breakfast buffet was not too well maintained. The location in the western part of Berlin is great but there are nicer hotels nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Crowne Plaza Berlin City Center
HotelInfo.Address: Nuernberger Strasse 65, 10787 Berlin, Germany
